 Inför rekryteringsarbetet har vi tagit ställning till annonskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanber oss därför ytterligare kontakt med media-/annonsförsäljare, rekryteringssajter och liknande.
   

  

 Pensionsmyndigheten ansvarar för den allmänna pensionen och informerar om hela pensionen. Varje år betalar vi ut cirka 415 miljarder kronor till 2,3 miljoner pensionärer, genomför cirka 911 000 fondbyten och skickar ut 8 miljoner orange kuvert. Vi har ca 25 miljoner digitala kundkontakter per år. Vi är cirka 1700 medarbetare på åtta orter, från Luleå i norr till Halmstad i söder.
   

  

 Vi gör pensionen enklare!
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: PSL 2025-66 | Kontakt: Anni Axelsson , | Facklig företrädare: Rickard Rundgren, ST 010-4543115, Anna-Karin Åhrman Cortelius, Saco-s 010-4543914, | Publicerat: 2025-05-15 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-05-21

title: Webbredaktör och scrum master
description:
Vill du vara med och förbättra upplevelsen för våra kunder? Vi söker en webbredaktör och scrum master. En webbredaktör som utvecklar digitalt innehåll av hög kvalitet och som utgår ifrån kundernas behov och situation. Du skapar ett enkelt och guidande innehåll som hjälper våra kunder att lösa sin situation på ett snabbt och smidigt sätt. I rollen ingår även att stötta teamledaren som scrum master med arbetsuppgifter inom administration, planering och uppföljning. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!

**Om jobbet**  

I rollen som webbredaktör får du möjlighet att vara med och driva Skatteverkets digitala utveckling framåt med fokus på kundens upplevelse. I arbetet ingår det att ta fram, kvalitetsgranska, publicera och underhålla samt optimera webbsidor och innehåll, bland annat utifrån webbanalys, användartester och tjänstedesign. Du kommer jobba med innehållsutveckling, tonalitet och innehållsstruktur. Det kan också innebära att delta i arbete med att utveckla vårt redaktionella arbetssätt samt kravställning för CMS-verktyg. Du arbetar även med verktyg som Matomo, Siteimprove, Jira och Confluence.


Du kommer att arbeta agilt i olika team där du skriver redaktionella texter tillsammans med de som har verksamhetskunskap, förenklar språket i vårt innehåll på webben och skapar innehåll i och för de tjänster vi erbjuder våra kunder. Arbetet innebär även tätt samarbete med många experter i organisationen. Som webbredaktör får du möjlighet att ta ett stort eget ansvar och säkerställa att innehållet håller hög kvalitet avseende kundfokus, användbarhet och tillgänglighet.


I rollen som scrum master stöttar du teamledaren med administration, planering och uppföljning som rör teamet. Du kommer att ha ansvar för att förbereda och hålla i planering, följa upp aktiviteter och leda möten. En viktig del i rollen är att hjälpa till att identifiera hinder och problem för teamet och stötta för att lösa ut dem.


Du har flexibel arbetstid och det är en självklarhet för oss att du ska ha balans mellan arbete och fritid.


Du tillhör sektionen webb och intranät på enheten kundrelationer och kommunikation på Kund- och kommunikationsavdelningen med placering i Örebro. På vår sektion är vi 20 kollegor.

**Om dig**  

För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.


I det här jobbet ska du:

* ha en god samarbetsförmåga och lätt för att arbeta med personer med olika kompetenser
* ha en god kommunikativ och pedagogisk förmåga
* kunna arbeta självständigt och fatta egna beslut
* vara utvecklingsinriktad, nyfiken på nya arbetssätt och nya sätt att kommunicera.


Du ska även ha:

* relevant högskoleutbildning om 180 hp (120 p) inom kommunikation alternativt flerårig aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete där motsvarande kunskaper förvärvats exempelvis som webbredaktör.
* minst fem års aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet som webbredaktör.
* aktuell erfarenhet från arbete med stora externa webbplatser på statlig myndighet.
* aktuell erfarenhet av arbete med verktygen Sitevision, Matomo och Jira.
* aktuell erfarenhet av arbete som scrum master för ett team.


Det är önskvärt att du har aktuell kunskap om och aktuell erfarenhet av arbete på Skatteverket sedan tidigare, och inom UX copy, klarspråk, samt webbkommunikation och agila arbetssätt.


Även tidigare erfarenhet som förvaltningsledare och administrativt stöd är önskvärt.

**Bra att veta**  

Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.


En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.


På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.


När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.


Välkommen med din ansökan!


Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.


Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Örebro | Län: Örebro län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/449 | Kontakt: Lars Högström, hr specialist 010-5749156, Jens Eriksson, sektionschef 010-5749612, | Facklig företrädare: Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, Viking Hermén, ST 010-5748013, Therese Sjödin, Seko 010-5741405, | Publicerat: 2025-05-19 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-05-23

title: Product/UX Designer
description:
We’re looking for a Product /UX Designer to join our team and help us craft seamless and intuitive customer journeys across our products in the dynamic world of crypto payments.


If you’re passionate about digital product design, thrive in close collaboration with tech teams, and want to grow your skills and impact, this role is for you!

**About Quickbit:**


Quickbit has been leading the way in cryptocurrency transactions since 2016, dedicated to simplifying access to cryptocurrency and empowering individuals and businesses with seamless, secure payments. Listed on NGM Nordic SME since July 2019, Quickbit stands as a pioneer in financial innovation. Our culture is built on collaboration, innovation, and a commitment to making a positive impact on the future of digital currency.

**About the Role:**


As a Product /UX Designer, you’ll play a key role in our Product team, working closely with developers and stakeholders to ensure user-centered design across web and app products. You’ll design user flows and interfaces from concept to final design, always balancing technical feasibility and aesthetic quality. You’ll also contribute to our evolving design system and be an active part of improving user experience across the full product lifecycle.

**Key Responsibilities:**

  

* Design and develop intuitive UX flows and UI for web and app products.
* Collaborate closely with tech teams and stakeholders in day-to-day product and development processes.
* Work systematically with existing design systems and help build and refine components for efficiency and consistency.
* Prepare and lead design workshops and present design proposals.
* Analyze customer data and user feedback to identify improvement opportunities.
* Balance technical constraints with design quality to deliver the best possible user experience.
* Contribute throughout the full process, from early concepts to high-fidelity design.
* Understand and map out customer journeys and needs.

 **Requirements:**

  

* Approximately 2 years of experience as a Product/UX Designer or similar role.
* Proficiency in Figma and experience working with design systems.
* Ability to design and develop user flows and interfaces for both web and mobile platforms.
* Experience collaborating directly with development teams.
* Strong understanding of UX principles and user-centered design.
* Ability to balance technical feasibility with design aesthetics.
* Experience working from concept to final design delivery.
* Experience from design contribution in an agile development setup
* Fluency in both spoken and written Swedish and English.

 **We would also prefer if you have:**

* Experience contributing to or building a design systems from scratch.
* Familiarity with UX research methods and A/B testing.
* Experience in industries such as fintech or e-commerce.
* Ability to facilitate workshops and collaborate across teams.
* Basic understanding of CSS and frontend frameworks.

 **What We Offer:**


At Quickbit, we believe work should be enjoyable, which is why we embrace a strict “No a-hole policy.” We're all about helping each other out and making sure everyone feels valued and happy!


In addition to a pretty awesome, laid back and friendly workplace culture, we offer:

  

* Flexibility: Flexible remote work? Absolutely! We prioritise results, not location. However, we also enjoy gathering at the office for team bonding and collaboration, and we look forward to seeing you there too.
* Private Healthcare: Need a doctor in a hurry? We've got you covered with quick access to medical pros.
* Occupational Pension: Think of it as a monthly high-five to your future self!
* Team Activities: Let’s get social! Join us for regular team activities to build those strong bonds.
* Health and Fitness: Time to get your sweat on! Enjoy our yearly allowance for fun fitness activities.
* City Center Location: Conveniently situated in the heart of Stockholm.
* Free dog snuggles! When working from the office, you’ll occasionally get the exclusive benefit of cuddling with Maggan, Charlie and Sally!

 **Interview Process:**


The interview process will consist of both interviews and a case assignment, we will also ask you to share your design portfolio in the application process. Our hiring team will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis. If you feel that this is the role for you, submit your application today!


Start Date: To be mutually agreed upon.


We hope to hear from you soon!

title: Communication Manager with strong UX design and...
description:
**We are looking for a Communication Manager with strong UX design-and copywriting experience for a company in the banking industry.** **This role can be located in either Stockholm, Malmö or Helsingborg.** **Start August 11th, 4-5 months** **contract to begin with.**

**Job description:**

  

Communication management and content skills:

* Define a clear communication strategy for clear, consistent, and timely information cross channels.
* Set-up a strategy to gather feedback from product rollouts and convert them into actionable insights.
* Create clear and relevant copy and video clips for the different communication channels.Support in the creation of educational material for different user groups.


User experience (UX) designer with strong UX writing skills:

* Improve the user journey (Web & Mobile) for the onboarding and utilization of new tools and way of working for Nordea employees, spread out in different countries.
* Writing and editing clear and functional UX writing in English for product onboarding and product features.
* Ensure a data-driven approach to continuously optimize the user journey.
* Conduct user research and end-user tests.

**Description of knowledge and experience**


Required:

* Minimum of 5 years of experience in communication management, UX design, UX writing and copywriting, preferably in multifactor authentication products.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Fluent or highly proficient in both spoken and written English
* Proven ability to understand and manage complexity.
* Proven ability to drive change in a distributed set-up and multicultural environment.
* Experience with IT implementations, particularly Windows Hello for Business, is a plus.
* Collaborative, problem-solving, and analytical skills.

  

This is a full-time consultant position through Incluso in Stockholm, Malmö or Helsingborg. Start is August 11th, 4-5 months limited contract to begin with. This role is 100% on-site in either Stockholm, Malmö or Helsingborg.


Please submit your CV as soon as possible since we will review the applications on an on-going basis.


For more information about this role, please contact Marianne Nilsson, recruiter at Incluso.

title: Senior UX/UI-designer
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Jobbeskrivning**  

Vi behöver en UX/UI-designer med övervikt/tyngd på UI, som kommer att arbeta operativt i ett team, göra prototyper och vara hands-on hjälp till utvecklarna och samarbeta med andra UX/UI-are.  

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**  

* Mycket välbekant med Figma
* Erfarenhet av designsystem
* Erfarenhet från försäkring/finans
* Har jobbat med Safe och agila team
* Van att jobba direkt med utvecklare
* Lång erfarenhet (minst 5-7 år)
* Van att lösa komplexa problem
* Meriterande med kunskap avHotJar och/eller Google Tag manager
* Meriterande om erfarenhet finns av skapande av säljande flöden

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 22-05-2025 **Om Deploja**  

Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.  

  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?

 *Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: Product Manager - 100% Remote (from anywhere in Europe) (m/f/d)
description:
**At Digistore24, we’re building a best-in-class ecommerce platform used by tens of thousands of entrepreneurs and SMEs to sell digital products, courses, memberships, and more. As a Remote Product Manager, you’ll join one of our cross-functional product teams to solve meaningful user problems, drive measurable business outcomes, and help shape the future of our platform.**

  


\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*


**This is not a Product Owner role** focused on backlog management — we're looking for a **true Product Manager** who owns the **why** and **what**, works closely with engineering and design, collaborates strongly with stakeholders and leads through product discovery, strategy, and execution.



=> **This role requires strong English skills,** as it’s our primary working language. German is a plus, but not required.

 **Who is Digistore24?**



We are one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe.


**What drives us?** **We shape the digital future!** Our mission is to empower people with our software and expertise to share their knowledge online, enabling them to fulfill their dream of an own business. As a result, millions of people gain access to information that helps them reach their goals. To keep pace with our growth, we aim to expand our teams sustainably. We emphasize working with experts and strong personalities who share our values – regardless of their location.

  

**Your new dream job**
----------------------



As a Product Manager at Digistore24, you'll join one of our cross-functional product teams and take ownership of a specific product domain. Your mission is to deeply understand our users, uncover valuable opportunities, and lead your team to deliver meaningful outcomes — all in alignment with the company’s broader product strategy and business goals.



Here’s what you’ll do:


* **Drive outcomes, not output:** Define and own clear product goals for your domain that support the company’s strategic priorities — and lead your team to deliver measurable results.
* **Lead product discovery:** Partner with Design and Engineering to understand user needs, explore ideas, test assumptions, and iterate fast — so we build what really matters.
* **Own the roadmap for your domain:** Shape the roadmap based on user insights, strategic impact, and technical feasibility — and communicate it clearly to stakeholders.
* **Collaborate across disciplines:** Work closely with Design, Engineering, and other teams to ensure we deliver high-quality, intuitive, and scalable solutions.
* **Engage stakeholders as thought partners:** Collaborate closely with marketing, support, legal, and senior management — not just to gather input, but to align on goals and co-create solutions. You’ll work with stakeholders at eye level, grounded in mutual respect and shared ownership of outcomes.

 **Your benefits at Digistore24**



At Digistore24, we believe that great people do their best work when given real autonomy, clarity of purpose, and a supportive environment. Here’s what you can expect when you join us:



* **Work from anywhere, on your schedule**: Whether from home or your favorite coworking space (3 days a week) — as long as you have a stable internet connection, your work location and hours are flexible (MO-FR).
* **Continuous learning:** Access to regular training opportunities and development resources to grow your skills and career.
* **Stable, founder-led business:** We’re a profitable German high-tech company — funded by our successful product, not outside investors.
* **Empowered, outcome-focused teams**: Join a product culture built on autonomy, ownership, and direct feedback — not micromanagement.
* **Tools that fit your workflow**: Choose the hardware that suits you best, whether MacBook Pro or ThinkPad.
* **International, collaborative culture**: Work with an international team of thoughtful, driven people
* **Real human connection**: Enjoy spectacular in-person team events across Europe to build relationships beyond screens.
* **Ownership from day one**: You’ll be trusted to make decisions and drive impact right from the start.
* **No dress code. No egos. Just teams solving problems together.**
**Your superpowers**
--------------------


* **You’re a strong communicator and facilitator**: You can bring clarity to complex problems, align diverse stakeholders around shared goals, and help teams move forward with focus and purpose.
* **You think in outcomes, not just features**: You define success through the impact we create for users and the business — and you know how to break that down into actionable, testable product work.
* **You speak tech fluently**: You enjoy working closely with engineers, understand technical constraints, and can engage in meaningful conversations around trade-offs.
* **You lead through discovery**: You’re comfortable with ambiguity and skilled at validating assumptions, gathering user insights, and running lightweight experiments to reduce risk before building.
* **You’re hands-on when needed**: Whether mapping out a user flow, refining an experiment, or digging through product analytics — you're proactive and unafraid to dive into the details when it matters.

**This position is NOT for you if**
-----------------------------------


* … you have no experience building customer-facing applications or working closely with Product Designers on UI/UX
* … you are uncomfortable with ownership and accountability — and prefer being told exactly what to build and how to do it
* … you get overly attached to your own ideas instead of staying open to evidence, user feedback, and data
* … you wait for others to set direction — this role requires someone who takes initiative and drives progress proactively, even in the face of ambiguity
* you get overly attached to your own ideas instead of staying open to evidence, user feedback, and data
* … you are uncomfortable with ownership and accountability — and prefer being told exactly what to build and how to do it
* … you have no experience building customer-facing applications or working closely with Product Designers on UI/UX
* … you avoid difficult decisions or conversations — clear communication and proactive problem-solving are part of the job
* … you rely solely on stakeholders for direction instead of identifying opportunities through discovery
* **⁠**… you have less than 3 years of experience working as a Product Manager in a cross-functional product team

**Our values**  

https://careers.digistore24.com/en/culture-and-core-values



Please take a REALLY close look at the values. Are you ready to live them?

 **Your typical day at Digistore24**



Every day looks a little different, but here’s how a typical day as a Product Manager at Digistore24 might unfold:

  

* **Start with focus**: You begin your day reviewing key metrics and digging into recent shifts in user behavior and feedback — looking for signals that might influence upcoming priorities.
* **Team sync**: You join your cross-functional team’s daily standup. Engineering shares progress, and you help resolve a blocker by aligning with a stakeholder on a dependency.
* **Deep work & discovery**: You block a few hours for discovery — analyzing product analytics, preparing interview notes, or mapping out different approaches to a tricky problem you’re trying to solve.
* **Stakeholder collaboration:** You hop on a call with Support and Legal to bounce around ideas for a new feature. Their insights into operational constraints and edge cases help you shape a more robust solution before bringing it to the team.
* **Collaboration & critique**: Later, you join a working session with your product designer to review early sketches for a new experience. You brainstorm ways to make it simpler and more intuitive.
* **Alignment & prioritization**: You catch up with your Engineering Manager to discuss trade-offs and refine the next slice of work. You revisit the roadmap and adjust backlog items to reflect new learnings.
* **Stakeholder alignment**: In the afternoon, you meet with Sales and Marketing to share what’s coming next, gather feedback on recent launches, and make sure everyone’s in sync.
* **Wrap up with clarity**: Before finishing your day, you document key learnings, sketch out next steps, and summarize key context for the team — helping everyone stay aligned and focused.
* You close your laptop knowing you’ve moved the product — and the team — forward.

title: Senior Web & Digital Experience Manager
description:
At Intrum, you will grow by making a difference. You will do it in a highly international environment and in a supportive culture where effort counts.

**Are you our new Senior Web & Digital Experience Manager**


The Senior Web & Digital Experience Manager is responsible for the strategic direction, governance, and optimization of Intrum's corporate and local websites. Acting as the business owner of the CMS and corporate web platform, the role ensures Intrum's digital presence, supports business objectives, delivers a seamless and consistent user experience, and complies with legal, regulatory and brand standards.


This is a key role for a commercially minded digital leader, who understands how content, user experience and digital platforms drive marketing impact and business value. This position serves as a key interface between the business, IT, external development partners, and local web editors, ensuring operational excellence and strategic progression of our digital estate.

**Location:** Stockholm

**What will you do**:

**Strategy and platform development:**

* Define and implement the web strategy for Intrum, aligned with business priorities, user needs, and brand direction.
* Develop and maintain the strategic roadmap for ongoing platform improvements, ensuring future readiness and scalability.
* Ability to plan and execute tasks with careful consideration of budget constraints and financial efficiency.

**Governance and standards:**

* Establish and maintain web governance frameworks, including standards for content management, SEO, UX, accessibility, and branding.
* Ensure compliance with legal and regulatory requirements in partnership with Risk & Compliance, Legal, and IT Security.

**Stakeholder and supplier management:**

* Act as the business lead towards the IT function and external web development agency.
* Participate as business owner in digital development sprints, including scoping, prioritisation, requirement definition, QA coordination, and release follow-up.
* Maintain effective communication and alignment with internal stakeholders including IR, Legal, Compliance, and Finance.

**User Experience and performance:**

* Drive the continuous improvement of site structure, design, and functionality to optimise usability and engagement.
* Monitor and report on key website KPIs using tools such as GA4 and Google Tag Manager, in collaboration with external analytics partners.
* Lead initiatives focused on conversion rate optimisation and internal search performance.

**Market support and enablement:**

* Provide governance and guidance to local web editors, ensuring consistency with global standards and efficient content workflows.
* Oversee support structures for CMS access, training, and ongoing enablement through internal resources or external support partners.

**Content oversight:**

* Oversee the publishing of strategic content on the corporate site, including financial, legal, and reputational communications.
* Collaborate with content owners to ensure accuracy, timeliness, and alignment with brand and tone-of-voice guidelines.

**What we’re looking for**:

* Minimum 8 years of experience in digital/web management, preferably in a complex, multi-market corporate environment.
* Strong understanding of CMS platforms (preferably Umbraco), web architecture, and digital governance.
* Demonstrated experience in leading web development projects, managing external suppliers, and collaborating cross-functionally.
* Solid knowledge of SEO, UX principles, web analytics (GA4), and conversion rate optimisation.
* Familiarity with GDPR, cookie compliance tools (e.g. OneTrust), and accessibility standards (e.g. WCAG).
* Excellent project management, communication, and stakeholder engagement skills.

**What we offer**: At Intrum we offer not only a challenging and rewarding career but also:

* A challenging, exciting and developing position in an international company with growth ambitions
* Highly motivated and skilled co-workers globally
* Being part of a supportive culture where effort counts
* We facilitate your learning through different learning arenas

**About Intrum**:


Intrum is the industry-leading provider of credit management services across 20 markets in Europe. By helping companies to get paid and support people with their late payments, Intrum leads the way to a sound economy and plays a critical role in society at large.


Intrum has circa 10,000 dedicated professionals who serve around 80,000 companies across Europe.


At Intrum we consider everybody to be a leader. We lead ourselves when collaborate to meet the needs of our clients and customers. We are all accountable to our actions as well as trust and care for each other. This makes us all leaders, independent of role or responsibility, and this is reflected in our 3 leadership principles: Deliver Impact, Inspire Trust and Embrace Growth.

**How to apply**: If you are interested in this position and believe you have the right qualifications, please send your English CV and a cover letter via the “apply button”


\*\*Please note that as a multinational company, our Global Talent Acquisition Partners is based in Spain. You might receive a call with a Spanish phone number.\*\*


At Intrum we strive to create a diverse and inclusive workplace. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply.


Do you feel that you might be the right person? Great! Apply now. Looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Bostadsförmedlingen söker UX/UI-designer för tidsbegränsat uppdrag
description:
Bostadsförmedlingen i Stockholm AB, avdelningen för Utveckling och IT

*Bostadsförmedlingen i Stockholm förmedlar hyreslägenheter i hela Stockholmsregionen och samarbetar med över 200 fastighetsägare. Vi är en länk mellan bostadssökande och fastighetsägare, med mer än 75 års erfarenhet av Stockholms hyresmarknad. Vi är cirka 130 medarbetare och ingår i koncernen Stockholms Stadshus AB som ägs av Stockholms stad. Vår vision är att vara det självklara valet för en effektiv och rättvis bostadsförmedling.*

**Välkommen till oss**


Vårt uppdrag på avdelningen för utveckling och IT är att sköta drift och underhåll av bolagets IT-system, bidra till vidareutveckling av metoder och processer samt vara navet i det bolagsövergripande utvecklingsarbetet. Vi är idag omkring 20 medarbetare som jobbar med bolagets interna och externa tjänster, såväl analoga som digitala. Hos oss jobbar bland annat systemutvecklare, testare, projektledare, kravanalytiker och systemförvaltare.


Hos oss på Bostadsförmedlingen blir du en del av en kultur som präglas av ett generöst och hjälpsamt arbetsklimat där det avsätts tid för kompetensutveckling och kunskapsutbyten. Det är viktigt med balans mellan arbete och fritid och vi är måna om att underlätta för dig att göra hälsosamma val. Vi erbjuder därför bland annat massage på arbetet, en friskvårdstimme i veckan, ett generöst friskvårdsbidrag och möjlighet till semesterväxling. Vi sitter i lokaler i Slakthusområdet vid Globen. Vi är på plats på kontoret två-tre dagar i veckan.


Vår gemensamma värdegrund sammanfattas i ordet GRETA som står för: Glädje-Respekt-Engagemang-Tillsammans-Ansvar.


När du jobbar på Bostadsförmedlingen är du varje dag med och bidrar till nytta för regionens invånare genom att göra vägen till en ny bostad lite enklare. Läs gärna mer på bostad.stockholm.se.

**Om rollen**


Vi genomför nu en satsning för att uppgradera och vidareutveckla vårt interna verksamhetssystem och som UXUI/-designer hos oss får du ta ett stort eget ansvar och du kommer att ha en avgörande roll i denna satsning.


Du arbetar med kunderna i fokus och du jobbar nära verksamhetsutvecklare, systemutvecklare, testare och systemförvaltare samt slutanvändare.

**Din kompetens och erfarenhet**


Vi söker dig som har en mångårig erfarenhet av att arbeta som UX/UI-designer. Du behöver ha en god kunskap och erfarenhet av att arbeta med UX/UI för verksamhetssystem vars syfte är att stödja en regelstyrd verksamhet.


Ordning och reda, service, struktur och att agera förutsättningsskapande är dina ledord i arbetet. Du har goda kunskaper av att kommunicera på svenska i tal och skrift. Du vill arbeta i ett prestigelöst team där var och en tar ett stort ansvar både för sina respektive uppgifter och för att hela teamet löser aktuella uppdrag.


För den här tjänsten krävs det att du har:

* Flerårig erfarenhet av att självständigt arbete med UX/UI design i större projekt i komplexa organisationer.
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av att arbete med digital tillgänglighet.
* Ett nyfiket, analytiskt och lösningsfokuserat mindset.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i designverktyg.


Meriterande:

* Kunskap och erfarenhet av att arbeta inom offentlig sektor


Rollen innebär många kontaktytor och du behöver ha en god förmåga att samarbeta, vara relationsskapande samtidigt som du kan arbeta självständigt och strukturerat. Att du kan hålla deadline är ett måste.


Vid rekryteringen lägger vi stor vikt vid dina kompetenser, personlig lämplighet, motivation och intresse för tjänsten.

**Övrigt**


Bostadsförmedlingen arbetar med kompetensbaserad rekrytering som syftar till att se till varje persons kompetens och därmed motverka diskriminering. Vi ser mångfald som berikande och välkomnar alla sökande.


När du skickar in din ansökan får du svara på frågor som är avgörande för vårt fortsatta urvalsarbete för den här specifika tjänsten. Vi önskar att du svarar konkret och kortfattat på frågorna, och att det finns en tydlig koppling mellan dina svar och ditt CV.

 **Välkommen med din ansökan!**

### 


Anställningsform: tidsbegränsad anställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/2662 | Kontakt: Jacqueline Lagercrantz, rekryteringskonsult 08-50811707, Lillemor Hult, ansvarig chef 08-7858893, | Facklig företrädare: Lorena Persson Waldhagen 08-7858800, Pepita Tengblad 08-7858800, | Publicerat: 2025-05-19 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-06-02

title: Senior UX & Communication Manager to a leading player in the banking ind...
description:
We’re seeking a dynamic Senior UX & Communication Manager for an exciting full-time consulting assignment with a client in the banking industry.
  
The assignment runs from August 8th 2025 to December 31st 2025, with possible extension.
  
About the roleYou will lead and execute clear communication strategies while enhancing user experiences for internal digital tools across several countries. Working closely with cross-functional teams, you’ll shape onboarding experiences, optimize digital touchpoints and ensure that communication and UX design are fully aligned. The role reports to a senior stakeholder within the digital workplace transformation program.
  
Responsibilities Define and implement a cross-channel communication strategy for consistent, timely internal messaging
  
Develop a feedback strategy to capture and translate user insights into action
  
Create engaging copy and video content tailored to different user groups and platforms
  
Design onboarding journeys and educational materials for internal tools (web & mobile)
  
Write clear, functional UX copy for product onboarding and in-app user guidance
  
Lead user research and testing to ensure usability and adoption
  
Drive continuous improvement using a data-driven approach to user experience
  
Collaborate with stakeholders across multiple countries and departments
  
About you
  
You are an experienced communicator and UX expert who thrives in complex environments and understands how to align product design with user behavior and strategic goals. With a strong foundation in both communication strategy and UX writing, you bring clarity and consistency to every touchpoint. Your analytical mindset, combined with excellent interpersonal skills, enables you to navigate multicultural and distributed organizations effectively.
  
Experience and skills Minimum 5 years of experience in communication management, UX design, UX writing, and copywriting
  
Demonstrated ability to lead communication and UX efforts in complex digital environments
  
Strong background in user journey design and iterative optimization
  
Proven skills in user research, testing, and data-driven UX improvements
  
Experience with multifactor authentication products; familiarity with Windows Hello for Business is a plus
  
Excellent command of spoken and written English
  
Skilled at managing change in multicultural and geographically distributed settings
  
Strong analytical, collaborative, and problem-solving skills
  
About the assignment
  
For this assignment you will be hired as a full-time consultant by Digitalenta. We offer our consultants a generous package including healthcare allowance, insurance policy, paid vacation days and pension savings. In addition, you'll also have a dedicated consultant manager available throughout your employment with us, in addition to optional networking activities with our network of consultants.

title: Produktägare Kund - digital utveckling med samhällsnytta i fokus
description:
Som Produktägare Kund leder du utvecklingen av våra kundnära digitala tjänster – som vår webbsida och självservicelösningar. Du ansvarar för att förstå våra hyresgästers behov, prioritera vad som ska utvecklas, och se till att vi skapar värde i varje steg av kundresan. Du ingår i vår digitala satsning, tillhör IT-avdelningen och jobbar i ett tvärfunktionellt team tillsammans med UX, IT och verksamheten.
  
  

Ditt uppdrag
  
Ansvara för nedbrytning av målbilder för kundprodukten – från idé till lansering
  
Prioritera utvecklingsinsatser utifrån kundinsikter, data och verksamhetsmål
  
Vara bryggan mellan användarna, verksamheten och tekniska team
  
Arbeta enligt agila principer och vara delaktig i vår resa mot ett produktorienterat arbetssätt
  
  

Vem är du?
  
Du är en nyfiken och strukturerad person som brinner för digitala kundupplevelser. Du gillar att jobba tvärfunktionellt och drivs av att lösa riktiga problem – med teknik som verktyg och människan i centrum.
  
  

**Vi tror att du har:**  

Erfarenhet av att vara produktägare, projektledare eller liknande inom digital utveckling
  
God förståelse för användarcentrerad utveckling, kundresor och digitala kontaktpunkter
  
En relevant utbildning inom t ex systemvetenskap, affärsutveckling eller motsvarande erfarenhet
  
Erfarenhet av agila metoder
  
God kunskap i det svenska språket i tal och skrift
  
  

**Meriterande om du har:**  

Kunskap inom tjänstedesign, UX och/eller CX
  
Jobbat med kundappar, boendetjänster eller digital självservice
  
Förståelse för fastighets- eller bostadsbranschen – eller annan samhällsnära sektor
  
  

Varför jobba hos oss?
  
Hos oss på Kopparstaden får du möjlighet att arbeta med digital utveckling som verkligen gör skillnad – för människors vardag, för hållbar hyresutveckling och för framtidens Falu kommun. Vi erbjuder ett meningsfullt jobb med samhällsnytta i fokus, där du får både påverkan och möjlighet att växa.
  
  

Kontakter
  
IT-chef Roland Nilsson 023-458 60
  
Vi har valt rekryteringsförfarande och vill därför inte bli kontaktade av säljbolag eller rekryteringsföretag.

title: Software Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
We are a people company. Our experienced, skilled and passionate people create best-in-class user-friendly solutions for our customers and partners to empower them to solve their challenges. And we are a technology company. We help our customers and partners to optimize processes through our software, hardware, and services. By connecting people and technologies we provide the means to accomplish goals and ambitions and to gain a competitive edge in today’s digitalized world.


**The opportunity**


We are looking for a skilled QA Engineer to join our R&D organization and the IX product team. The team is responsible for the IX Developer, a development environment that is used by our customers to create user interfaces to provide end-users with great UX, allowing them to interact with and control any industry process.


As a QA engineer you share the responsibility, both for the day-to-day QA work and the strategic perspective of how we work with quality long-term. If you have an interest in QA best practices like test automation and test strategies, this role will give you the opportunity to put theory into practice.


It is a plus if you also have an interest in Agile methodologies as there may be an opportunity to take on the role as the team’s Scrum Master with the goal to support the team in our ambition to continuously to improve our way of working.


The doors are open; we welcome you to join our R&D organization! This is for sure where the magic happens. It consists of several product teams working in the areas of software, hardware, and mechanics.


**The successful applicant**


We’re looking for an open-minded engineer who enjoys learning new things. At Beijer, we work with many different systems and tools, and we think that you are comfortable to quickly adapt to different development environments and setups.


You will be the voice of the user in terms of quality. That's why drive and good communication skills are important to be able to share your view of the product.


What we value for this role:


* Hands-on experience in testing software and/or automation systems
* Hands-on experience of risk-based testing
* Understanding the importance of non-functional requirements (performance, stability, etc)
* Experience in test automation
* Great skills in English, both written and verbal

A pure bonus if you also have:


* Understanding of the automation domain (PLC, HMI, communication)
* Experience of testing embedded systems
* Software development skills
* Knowledge of security testing
* DevOps experience
* Knowledge of agile methodologies
* Coaching skills

  

To succeed in this role, you need to be able to work from the office, in Malmö, at least three days per week.

 **Are you up for the challenge?**


Don’t wait, submit your application rather sooner than later. Looking forward hearing from you!  



  

*Beijer Electronics is a multinational, cross-industry innovator that connects people and technologies to optimize processes for business-critical applications. Our offer includes operator communication, automation solutions, digitalization, display solutions and support. As experts in user-friendly software, hardware and services for the Industrial Internet of Things, we empower our customers to meet their challenges through leading-edge solutions.*

title: User Researcher
description:
**About TrusTrace**

  

Founded in 2016, TrusTrace offers a market-leading platform for supply chain traceability and compliance, enabling brands and suppliers around the world to standardise how supply chain and material traceability data is captured, digitised and shared. TrusTrace is leading global-scale traceability programs for many of the world’s largest brands. The company is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, with additional offices in India, France and the US.


**About the role**

  

We’re strengthening our UX team with a **User Researcher** based in **Stockholm, Sweden**. You’ll report to the UX Director and work closely with designers and researchers in both Sweden and India.


This will be a fixed term contract role for a period of 12 months where you’ll take the lead on major research initiatives and manage the day-to-day research function.


You’ll play a key role in shaping how research drives product decisions across the platform — from traceability and risk screening to supplier collaboration and AI-first workflows.  

  

**What you will do**

  

* **Foundational User Research**  

	+ Conduct interviews, usability tests, and contextual inquiries to uncover user needs and behaviors.
	+ Synthesize insights into actionable recommendations for designers, PMs, and engineers.
	+ Share findings through engaging, decision-driving formats that promote alignment.**Research in an AI-Enabled World**  

	+ Use AI tools to accelerate discovery, synthesize feedback, and surface patterns from interviews, analytics, and support data.
	+ Build feedback loops and micro-studies directly into product workflows.
	+ Deliver real-time insights through collaborative formats like FigJam, Teams, and GPT-style research repositories.**Cross-Functional Collaboration**  

	+ Work with product, design, and engineering to shape discovery efforts and validate concepts.
	+ Influence product priorities and development cycles with timely, relevant user insights.**Participant Recruitment & User Access**  

	+ Manage and grow our research participant pool, especially among Asian suppliers and manufacturers.
	+ Support localization, outreach, and screening efforts for interviews and surveys.**Scale Research Through Systems**  

	+ Develop repeatable tools, templates, and research methods to improve efficiency.
	+ Mentor designers and PMs in lightweight, scalable research practices.

**Who you might be**

  

* 4–6 years of applied user research experience, ideally with B2B SaaS or enterprise platforms.
* Familiarity with supply chain, compliance, or traceability domains is a strong advantage.
* Comfortable using AI-enabled research tools and eager to explore new technologies.
* Skilled at delivering fast, actionable insights — not reliant on long reports.
* Experience working across time zones in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.
* Bonus: Proficiency in Mandarin, Cantonese, or other Asian languages, or past research experience in Asia-based manufacturing contexts.

  

**What do we offer?**

* The opportunity to drive change and break new grounds to enhance and strengthen the visual identity of a growing global scale-up company, committed to accelerate sustainable transformation in fashion.
* To be part of a great multicultural, multilingual team and a supportive, design-led culture with a UX team that values learning, experimentation, and real-world product impact.
* A hybrid work model with centrally located office in Stockholm in a tech/innovation co-working space.
* Opportunity to shape the research function and have lasting impact on a growing product organization.
* Opportunities to travel to India and other key regions as needed.

title: Software Engineer (C#) - Fleet Management
UX Designer
description:
**About TrusTrace**

  

Founded in 2016, TrusTrace offers a market-leading platform for supply chain traceability and compliance, enabling brands and suppliers around the world to standardise how supply chain and material traceability data is captured, digitised and shared. TrusTrace is leading global-scale traceability programs for many of the world’s largest brands. The company is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, with additional offices in India, France and the US.


**About the role**

  

We’re looking for a UX Designer to join our team and work closely with our Product Director on shaping a new, AI-first product. You’ll play a key role in designing the next generation of our platform — one that is AI-powered, intuitive, and accessible to a diverse range of users.


This is a fixed term contract for 12 months. The role offers space for creative ownership and tangible impact on a high-growth product.

 **What you will do**

  

* Own product areas from discovery through delivery — including flows, wireframes, prototypes, and final UI designs.
* Collaborate closely with the Product Team to design thoughtful user experiences.
* Turn complex data and compliance tasks into simple, intuitive workflows.
* Help define and design AI-powered features that support human decision-making in complex environments.
* Work with QA, engineering, and product to ensure design quality from concept to release.
* Contribute to and evolve our design system to maintain consistency and scalability across the platform.

**Who you might be**

* Self-motivated and comfortable working independently with structured collaboration.
* Skilled at prototyping and validating ideas through quick iterations.
* Experienced in conducting lightweight research and usability testing.
* Interested in both discovery and delivery — from ideation to shipped product.
* Detail-oriented and committed to quality at every stage of the product lifecycle.
* Curious about design impact and motivated to learn from user behavior and outcomes.
* Confident working with and extending design systems.

  

**What do we offer?**

* The opportunity to drive change and break new grounds to enhance and strengthen the visual identity of a growing global scale-up company, committed to accelerate sustainable transformation in fashion.
* A hybrid work model.
* A centrally located office in Stockholm with perks.
* To be part of a great multicultural, multilingual team and collaborative UX team that values learning, sharing, and delivering real-world impact.
* Opportunities to travel to India and other partner locations.

title: Principal Frontend Engineer
description:
***This is us***


At Avenga, we believe that human creativity empowers technology that matters. Operating globally, our 6000+ specialists provide a full spectrum of services, including business and tech advisory, enterprise solutions, CX, UX and Ul design, managed services, product development, and software development.

***This is the job***  

Our customer is a leading GameTech company operating in 17 markets worldwide, with a professional team from 40+ nationalities across three continents. Recognized as one of the Best Workplaces in Europe and a Great Place to Work.

  

We are looking for a Principal Frontend Engineer to join our team and play a key role in shaping the future of our platform.

 ***This is you***

* 7+ years of commercial experience as a Front-End Developer.
* Strong experience with Vue.js 3, VueX/Pinia, and micro frontend architecture.
* Expert in SPA Frameworks and especially Vue.js.
* Expert knowledge in Typescript/Javascript.
* Expertise in performance optimization, debugging, and scalability best practices.
* Solid background in frontend tooling (webpack, Vite), component libraries (Storybook), and testing frameworks (Jest, Vitest).
* Ability to mentor engineers, drive technical discussions, and challenge architectural decisions.

Passionate about delivering high-quality, user-centric experiences.  
* ***This is your role***
* + Lead by example – Contribute hands-on to development while setting high coding standards.
	+ Optimize performance – Use debugging tools like Lighthouse and ChromeUX to enhance frontend performance.
	+ Mentor and guide – Provide technical leadership, helping engineers grow and improve their skills.
	+ Build scalable solutions – Work with Product and Delivery teams to develop secure, high-performance applications.
	+ Drive innovation – Implement cutting-edge solutions, create POCs, and introduce best practices.
	+ Take ownership of frontend architecture – Act as the bridge between Engineering and Development Teams, ensuring smooth software delivery to browsers and mobile devices.
	  
	
	  
	
	W*e take pride in the diverse skills and character of our teams, welcoming everyone to apply and contribute to our collective strength*.

title: Engineering Manager - Data & Analytics
description:
**This is us**

At Avenga, we believe that human creativity empowers technology that matters. Operating globally, our 6000+ specialists provide a full spectrum of services, including business and tech advisory, enterprise solutions, CX, UX and Ul design, managed services, product development, and software development.


**This is the job**

As an Engineering Manager within Data & Analytics one of your most important tasks will be to create and cultivate a community that’s built on sharing knowledge, a sense of belonging and a high level of collaboration. You will lead this community by example, not just by being a strong leader who acts as a role model – but also by being someone who can deep-dive into a technical issue and facilitate a possible solution. You’ll do this by staying up to date with industry trends, new technologies and best practices whilst working on different projects for at least 80% of your time.


Your team will consist of a group of professionals who you will encourage to grow and evolve in their individual trajectories. You’ll conduct regular performance evaluations and provide constructive feedback that involves clear objectives suited for the team member. You will resolve disputes between employees and technical discussions with clients if needed.


You will work actively, both globally and locally, to find fulfilling assignments for the team and balance the workload within the team to ensure the utilization goals are met. You will ensure company processes and standards are followed within the team, share relevant information and most importantly drive a positive culture where all team members contribute. You will collaborate both globally within your competence as well as locally within Engineering.


**This is you**

To succeed as an Engineering Manager within Data & Analytics, we believe that you have an extensive background as a data engineer, BI-consultant, or similar roles to be able to help and guide your team. You’re well versed in databases, DWH-solutions and are used to working within the Azure-platform. You have designed, built and maintained scalable data pipelines and architectures. With your prior experience you’re also familiar with best practices, and overall know-how in which the team members are working with.


You’re passionate about the well-being and development of your team-members and you thrive in a role where you can inspire and bring out the best in them. With your prior experience in leading teams or projects you know how to address uncertainties and help facilitate the business going forward. This might come in the form of giving and receiving direct feedback but also prioritizing the right tasks.


You’re experienced in the consulting role and consider yourself versatile regarding different technologies, agile methods, and technical solutions. With a genuine interest in technology, you help your team evolve within their competence development and making the right technical decisions. You consider yourself a communicative and flexible individual who is able to create long-lasting relationships built on trust.


**Skills:**

* Preferred experience as a manager, team lead or similar roles
* A couple of years of experience with SQL, Python, and/or Scala
* Broad knowledge of concepts and architecture within Data Warehouse and more modern solutions such as Medallion/Lakehouse architecture
* A good understanding of DevOps processes, version control, CI/CD practices
* Comfortable in Swedish and English, both spoken and written since this is a global company
* Experience with Azure analytics platforms such as Synapse Analytics, Microsoft Fabric, or Databricks — or comparable data services on other cloud platforms (e.g., AWS or GCP).

**What awaits you at Avenga x Qinshift?**

Through our values, Better Minds, Bolder Ideas and Bigger Hearts, we strive to provide you with the tools, the autonomy, the trust, and assistance you need to excel. Enjoy benefits like private health insurance, well-being programs, flexible and hybrid work models, laptops and gear, trainings, language classes, social events, great offices, and more.


*We take pride in the diverse skills and character of our teams, welcoming everyone to apply and contribute to our collective strength.*

*We process the applications on an ongoing basis, which could mean that the process ends before the final application date, so don't wait to apply.*

title: Product Designer (6 month consultancy)
description:
We are looking for a product designer to join our team at 60-70% for an initial duration of 6 months, with the possibility of extension afterward.
 



  





**About Datastory:** 
  At Datastory, we are passionate about data visualization, data journalism and how to portray important global development questions. In order to enable anyone to tell compelling stories with data, we’re developing the Datastory platform. The product is optimized for Visualizations and Webpage types that are common in the fields of communicating with data. To enable quick data storytelling, Datastory has a unique approach to data management. It uses a “knowledge graph” based on Linked data and also provides a large set of curated Open data.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 
  We are seeking a highly skilled and hands-on Product Designer to join our Datastory team. The ideal candidate will have experience with SaaS platforms, a passion for user-centered design, and the ability to drive the user experience strategy from conception to implementation. This role is critical in ensuring our platform meets and exceeds user expectations by creating seamless and engaging user experiences.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




**User Testing and Research:** 



* Source and recruit users for continuous user testing to ensure diverse and representative feedback.
* Develop and implement comprehensive user testing strategies to gather qualitative and quantitative insights.
* Conduct user interviews, usability tests, and surveys to inform design decisions.
* Analyze user feedback and behavioral data to identify pain points, needs, and opportunities.



**UX Strategy and Roadmap:** 



* Define and drive the UX vision and strategy aligned with the overall product roadmap.
* Translate user research findings into actionable insights and prioritize them within the product development cycle.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams (product managers, developers, data scientists) to integrate UX findings into the product roadmap.
* Advocate for user-centered design principles and best practices across the organization.



**Design and Implementation:** 



* Create wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity designs.
* Ensure all design deliverables meet the highest standards of usability, accessibility, and visual appeal.
* Collaborate closely with development teams to ensure design feasibility and accurate implementation.



**Continuous Improvement:** 



* Stay up-to-date with the latest UX trends, tools, and technologies.
* Foster a culture of continuous improvement by regularly seeking and incorporating feedback.



  





**Qualifications:** 



* Proven experience as a Product Designer, preferably in SaaS or data-related products.
* Strong portfolio showcasing a range of user-centered design projects and methodologies.
* Experience with user research techniques, including interviews, usability testing and A/B testing.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret user data and translate it into actionable insights.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to articulate design decisions and advocate for the user perspective.
* Comfortable wearing many hats: as the only full-time platform designer, you need to be able to work on a wide spectrum of things from strategy to research to implementation-ready designs.



  





**Why Join Us:** 



* Be part of an innovative team dedicated to transforming data storytelling.
* Work in a dynamic and collaborative environment with opportunities for professional growth.
* Contribute to a product that has a meaningful impact on how data is communicated and understood.



 If you are passionate about creating exceptional user experiences and have a knack for translating user needs into compelling designs, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to join our Datastory team and help shape the future of data storytelling.
 



  





**How to Apply:** 
  Please submit your resume, portfolio, and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience, why you are excited about this role and your ideal start date to Katie at katie@datastory.org.

title: Product/UX Designer
description:
**If you’re passionate about digital product design, thrive in close collaboration with tech teams, and want to grow your skills and impact, this role is for you!** 




  





 We’re looking for a Product /UX Designer to join our team and help us craft seamless and intuitive customer journeys across our products in the dynamic world of crypto payments.
 



  





 If you’re passionate about digital product design, thrive in close collaboration with tech teams, and want to grow your skills and impact, this role is for you!
 



  





**About Quickbit:** 




  





 Quickbit has been leading the way in cryptocurrency transactions since 2016, dedicated to simplifying access to cryptocurrency and empowering individuals and businesses with seamless, secure payments. Listed on NGM Nordic SME since July 2019, Quickbit stands as a pioneer in financial innovation. Our culture is built on collaboration, innovation, and a commitment to making a positive impact on the future of digital currency.
 



  





**About the Role:** 




  





 As a Product /UX Designer, you’ll play a key role in our Product team, working closely with developers and stakeholders to ensure user-centered design across web and app products. You’ll design user flows and interfaces from concept to final design, always balancing technical feasibility and aesthetic quality. You’ll also contribute to our evolving design system and be an active part of improving user experience across the full product lifecycle.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  




* Design and develop intuitive UX flows and UI for web and app products.
* Collaborate closely with tech teams and stakeholders in day-to-day product and development processes.
* Work systematically with existing design systems and help build and refine components for efficiency and consistency.
* Prepare and lead design workshops and present design proposals.
* Analyze customer data and user feedback to identify improvement opportunities.
* Balance technical constraints with design quality to deliver the best possible user experience.
* Contribute throughout the full process, from early concepts to high-fidelity design.
* Understand and map out customer journeys and needs.



  





**Requirements:** 




  




* Approximately 2 years of experience as a Product/UX Designer or similar role.
* Proficiency in Figma and experience working with design systems.
* Ability to design and develop user flows and interfaces for both web and mobile platforms.
* Experience collaborating directly with development teams.
* Strong understanding of UX principles and user-centered design.
* Ability to balance technical feasibility with design aesthetics.
* Experience working from concept to final design delivery.
* Experience from design contribution in an agile development setup
* Fluency in both spoken and written Swedish and English.



  





**We would also prefer if you have:** 




  




* Experience contributing to or building a design systems from scratch.
* Familiarity with UX research methods and A/B testing.
* Experience in industries such as fintech or e-commerce.
* Ability to facilitate workshops and collaborate across teams.
* Basic understanding of CSS and frontend frameworks.



  





**What We Offer:** 




  





 At Quickbit, we believe work should be enjoyable, which is why we embrace a strict “No a-hole policy.” We're all about helping each other out and making sure everyone feels valued and happy!
 



  





 In addition to a pretty awesome, laid back and friendly workplace culture, we offer:
 



  




* Flexibility: Flexible remote work? Absolutely! We prioritise results, not location. However, we also enjoy gathering at the office for team bonding and collaboration, and we look forward to seeing you there too.
* Private Healthcare: Need a doctor in a hurry? We've got you covered with quick access to medical pros.
* Occupational Pension: Think of it as a monthly high-five to your future self!
* Team Activities: Let’s get social! Join us for regular team activities to build those strong bonds.
* Health and Fitness: Time to get your sweat on! Enjoy our yearly allowance for fun fitness activities.
* City Center Location: Conveniently situated in the heart of Stockholm.
* Free dog snuggles! When working from the office, you’ll occasionally get the exclusive benefit of cuddling with Maggan, Charlie and Sally!



  





**Interview Process:** 




  





 The interview process will consist of both interviews and a case assignment, we will also ask you to share your design portfolio in the application process. Our hiring team will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis. If you feel that this is the role for you, submit your application today!
 



  





 Start Date: To be mutually agreed upon.
 



  





 We hope to hear from you soon!

title: Designer
description:
**DESIGNER - SVENSKA POSTKODLOTTERIET** 




  





**Vi söker** 




 Nu letar vi efter en formstark och noggrann Designer med 1–3 års erfarenhet, som vill ta nästa steg i karriären! Är du en fena på digital och grafisk produktion och kan starta omgående? Då kan det vara dig vi söker för ett spännande uppdrag på heltid hos Svenska Postkodlotteriet – en arbetsplats där idéer, tempo och meningsfullt syfte går hand i hand.
 



  





**Arbetsbeskrivning** 




 Som Designer hos Postkodlotteriet blir du en viktig del av det kreativa teamet. Du producerar material oavsett media och arbetar tätt ihop med kreatörerna. Här får du möjlighet att skapa kommunikation som syns och gör skillnad!
 



  





**I dina arbetsuppgifter ingår bland annat att:** 



* Producera och formatanpassa för digitala och tryckta kanaler.
* Redigera och anpassa både stillbild och rörligt material.



  





**Din profil** 




 Vi söker dig som har 1–3 års erfarenhet från en liknande roll, gärna från en inhouseavdelning eller reklambyrå. Du är van vid att producera för digitala format, rörligt innehåll och print. Du har en grafisk utbildning i grunden och mycket goda kunskaper Adobe Creative Suite samt kunskap i Figma och Bannerflow. Du är strukturerad, lösningsorienterad och trivs med att jobba i ett högt tempo med flera projekt samtidigt. Du gillar att samarbeta, är prestigelös och får saker att hända.
 



  





**Övrig information** 




 Visst låter det spännande? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag, vi intervjuar löpande! Uppdraget är en visstidsanställning på heltid med start så snart som möjligt, fram till den 31 augusti. Ledighet under 2–3 veckor i juli är helt okej. Du jobbar på plats i Postkodlotteriets fina lokaler i centrala Stockholm.
 



  





*WorkStudio arbetar med kompetensbaserad metodik i sina rekryteringar och hanterar alla kvalificerade ansökningar utan hänsyn till kön, ålder och bakgrund.*

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us— and let the world feel your work.**
**The role**
 As a Senior Product Designer at Epidemic Sound, you'll play a key role in shaping our user experience. Your creative ideas and strategic thinking will drive the development of our digital product offering that delights our customers and elevates our brand.
   

  

 Collaborating closely with designers, product managers, analysts, developers, and leadership, you'll help build and ship intuitive, visually appealing products that meet both user needs and business objectives.
   

  

**Your key responsibilities include:**
* Own the user experience and design output for your product team, ensuring high-quality results
* Lead end-to-end design processes, driving excellent outcomes for prioritized initiatives
* Identify UX gaps and opportunities, shaping strategic improvements
* Influence product strategy by leading visioning and user experience planning
* Foster a culture of design sharing, feedback, and critique within the team
* Contribute to the evolution of design systems, patterns, and standards, ensuring consistency and scalability across platforms


**Requirements:**
* Strong craft skills in user experience and digital user interface design
* Excellent communication, presentation and storytelling skills
* In depth knowledge of established UX and UI patterns
* In depth knowledge in applying design processes and methods to effectively take lead on complex key initiatives
* In depth knowledge in planning, conducting and synthesizing user research
* In depth knowledge of understanding and following up on data and analytics
* Knowledge in how to effectively manage stakeholder relationships to influence others and lead change


**Soft Skills**
* Ability to inspire and lead through excellent design craftsmanship
* Positive, constructive attitude that energizes and motivates others
* Clear, effective communication of ideas and justification for design decisions


**Equal opportunity employer**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Ready to make the world feel your work? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link “apply” below.
   

  

**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: Bostadsförmedlingen söker UX/UI-designer för tidsbegränsat uppdrag
description:
Bostadsförmedlingen i Stockholm AB, avdelningen för Utveckling och IT
 



*Bostadsförmedlingen i Stockholm förmedlar hyreslägenheter i hela Stockholmsregionen och samarbetar med över 200 fastighetsägare. Vi är en länk mellan bostadssökande och fastighetsägare, med mer än 75 års erfarenhet av Stockholms hyresmarknad. Vi är cirka 130 medarbetare och ingår i koncernen Stockholms Stadshus AB som ägs av Stockholms stad. Vår vision är att vara det självklara valet för en effektiv och rättvis bostadsförmedling.* 




  





**Välkommen till oss** 




 Vårt uppdrag på avdelningen för utveckling och IT är att sköta drift och underhåll av bolagets IT-system, bidra till vidareutveckling av metoder och processer samt vara navet i det bolagsövergripande utvecklingsarbetet. Vi är idag omkring 20 medarbetare som jobbar med bolagets interna och externa tjänster, såväl analoga som digitala. Hos oss jobbar bland annat systemutvecklare, testare, projektledare, kravanalytiker och systemförvaltare.
 



  





 Hos oss på Bostadsförmedlingen blir du en del av en kultur som präglas av ett generöst och hjälpsamt arbetsklimat där det avsätts tid för kompetensutveckling och kunskapsutbyten. Det är viktigt med balans mellan arbete och fritid och vi är måna om att underlätta för dig att göra hälsosamma val. Vi erbjuder därför bland annat massage på arbetet, en friskvårdstimme i veckan, ett generöst friskvårdsbidrag och möjlighet till semesterväxling. Vi sitter i lokaler i Slakthusområdet vid Globen. Vi är på plats på kontoret två-tre dagar i veckan.
 



  





 Vår gemensamma värdegrund sammanfattas i ordet GRETA som står för: Glädje-Respekt-Engagemang-Tillsammans-Ansvar.
 



  





 När du jobbar på Bostadsförmedlingen är du varje dag med och bidrar till nytta för regionens invånare genom att göra vägen till en ny bostad lite enklare. Läs gärna mer på bostad.stockholm.se.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Vi genomför nu en satsning för att uppgradera och vidareutveckla vårt interna verksamhetssystem och som UXUI/-designer hos oss får du ta ett stort eget ansvar och du kommer att ha en avgörande roll i denna satsning.
 



  





 Du arbetar med kunderna i fokus och du jobbar nära verksamhetsutvecklare, systemutvecklare, testare och systemförvaltare samt slutanvändare.
 



  





**Din kompetens och erfarenhet** 




 Vi söker dig som har en mångårig erfarenhet av att arbeta som UX/UI-designer. Du behöver ha en god kunskap och erfarenhet av att arbeta med UX/UI för verksamhetssystem vars syfte är att stödja en regelstyrd verksamhet.
 



  





 Ordning och reda, service, struktur och att agera förutsättningsskapande är dina ledord i arbetet. Du har goda kunskaper av att kommunicera på svenska i tal och skrift. Du vill arbeta i ett prestigelöst team där var och en tar ett stort ansvar både för sina respektive uppgifter och för att hela teamet löser aktuella uppdrag.
 



  





**För den här tjänsten krävs det att du har:** 



* Flerårig erfarenhet av att självständigt arbete med UX/UI design i större projekt i komplexa organisationer.
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av att arbete med digital tillgänglighet.
* Ett nyfiket, analytiskt och lösningsfokuserat mindset.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i designverktyg.



**Meriterande:** 



* Kunskap och erfarenhet av att arbeta inom offentlig sektor



  





 Rollen innebär många kontaktytor och du behöver ha en god förmåga att samarbeta, vara relationsskapande samtidigt som du kan arbeta självständigt och strukturerat. Att du kan hålla deadline är ett måste.
 



  





 Vid rekryteringen lägger vi stor vikt vid dina kompetenser, personlig lämplighet, motivation och intresse för tjänsten.
 



  





**Övrigt** 




 Bostadsförmedlingen arbetar med kompetensbaserad rekrytering som syftar till att se till varje persons kompetens och därmed motverka diskriminering. Vi ser mångfald som berikande och välkomnar alla sökande.
 



 När du skickar in din ansökan får du svara på frågor som är avgörande för vårt fortsatta urvalsarbete för den här specifika tjänsten. Vi önskar att du svarar konkret och kortfattat på frågorna, och att det finns en tydlig koppling mellan dina svar och ditt CV.
 



  





**Välkommen med din ansökan!** 




  





 Anställningsform: tidsbegränsad anställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/2662 | Kontakt: Jacqueline Lagercrantz, rekryteringskonsult 08-50811707, Lillemor Hult, ansvarig chef 08-7858893, | Facklig företrädare: Lorena Persson Waldhagen 08-7858800, Pepita Tengblad 08-7858800, | Publicerat: 2025-05-19 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-06-02
