title: Support- och tjänstekonsult Inom Utility
description:
*Vill du vara med och bidra till att våra kunder inom energibranschen blir ännu nöjdare? Och hjälpa till att förenkla för våra kunder i deras dagliga verksamhet?*
 Då är det nu du har chansen att ta din karriär till nya höjder!
   

  

 För att våra kunder ska kunna möta energimarknadens förändringar på ett effektivt sätt är vikten av moderna system- och tjänstleveranser avgörande. På EG har vi höga ambitioner för framtiden och är ledande i branschen.
   

  

 Nu vill vi förstärka vårt team med ytterligare en konsult som kommer att arbeta i ett team mot våra nuvarande och blivande kunder inom Utility-sektorn. Vi arbetar med stort kundfokus och hög servicenivå för att tillsammans uppnå den absolut bästa IT-lösningen för våra kunder.
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med placering kopplad till något av våra kontor i Östersund, Stockholm eller Örebro. Koncernspråket inom EG är engelska.
   

  

**Optimala Systemlösningar: Kundsupport, tjänster, implementering och projektdeltagande**
 Några exempel på arbetsuppgifter som förekommer:
   

  

* Agera support och stöd för våra kunder.
* Hantering av inkommande ärenden från Energiföretag som använder EG's systemlösning Zynergy.
* Aktivt arbeta och ta ansvar för tjänster som utförs både kontinuerligt och temporärt.
* Projekt- och konsultarbete hos kund.
* Medverka i säljaktiviteter tillsammans med våra säljare och övriga konsulter.


**Kundorienterad och innovativ inom Energibranschen**
 Vi förväntar oss att du:
   

  

* Har förmåga att förstå kundens behov och brinner för att ge bästa tänkbara service. Du är van att arbeta självständigt och ta ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter.
* Är strukturerad och kommunikativ med ett stort eget driv. Du har god förmåga att samverka inom teamet men också med andra team.
* Är tekniskt utbildad eller liknande och vi ser gärna att du har tidigare erfarenhet av liknande arbetsuppgifter inom energibranschen. Kunskaper i SQL är meriterande.


**Vad kan du förvänta dig av oss?**
* En professionell men informell miljö med närhet till våra kunder
* Stöd av erfarna kollegor som vet att framgång nås genom samarbete och erfarenhetsutbyte
* En dynamisk miljö med goda utvecklingsmöjligheter
* Möjlighet till, och stöd för, distansarbete på deltid
* En trivsam arbetsmiljö med marknadsmässig lön och villkor


 Tillsammans utgör vi ett ambitiöst och informellt team där det finns utrymme för mångfald och respekt för olikheter. Vi erbjuder en rolig och utvecklande arbetsmiljö med högt i tak där våra medarbetare ständigt utmanas av nya situationer och frågeställningar. Detta innebär att du får vara med och påverka utvecklingen av vårt affärssystem i hela kedjan från idé till färdig lösning.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

**Kontakt**
 Vill du veta mer om rollen innan du söker, är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Manager Mats Lundberg på telefon +46 (0)705-28 71 47 eller e-post malun@eg.se. Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande och anställer så snart vi hittat rätt kandidat. Skicka därför din ansökan snarast möjligt. Alla ansökningar hanteras konfidentiellt.
   

  

 På EG utvecklar vi programvara åt våra kunder så att de kan fokusera på sin kärnverksamhet.
   

  

 Våra branschspecifika lösningar skapas av experter med djup insikt i sina respektive områden och drivs av EG:s styrka när det gäller stabilitet, innovation och säkerhet.
   

  

 Vi vill driva utvecklingen framåt genom att lösa stora utmaningar – från resursanvändning och effektivitet till hållbarhet.
   

  

 Tillsammans skapar vi smart programvara som förenklar människors arbete – inte programvara som gör arbetet mer komplicerat.
   

  

 Läs mer om EG
   

  

 Besök vår karriärsida, där du kan se två inspirerande filmer:
   

  

 En där fyra av våra engagerade kollegor ger en inblick i sitt arbete på EG, och en annan om hur vi gör skillnad.

title: Internal Management Consultant (Strategy Manager)
description:
**Job Description**
 We are seeking an
 **Internal Management Consultant (Strategy Manager) for our Governance & Steering team in H&M Business Tech** 
 . Reporting directly to the Head of Steering & Governance you collaborate with Business Tech leadership and the governance & steering network. This role is pivotal for advancing our strategic tech agenda and ensuring effective steering and governance across H&M. The role will work across the team’s prioritized areas:
   

  

* Enablement of the Chief Digital Information Officer (CDIO) and Business Tech leadership and agenda.
* Facilitating strategic and tactical steering of the Business & Tech portfolio.
* IT Governance of the Business Tech function.


**WHAT YOU'LL DO:**
* Enable our strategic direction through quantitative and qualitative analysis and strategic outlooks.
* Shape strategic and tactical steering of H&M’s business and tech initiative portfolio.
* Implement and orchestrate practices, processes and collaboration translating strategies and plans into action.
* Collaborate closely with senior internal stakeholders across different departments to orchestrate tech governance and steering.
* Drive change at the intersection of business and technology, engaging across all phases of the strategy lifecycle.


**WHAT YOU ARE:**
 We believe you are a compassionate and driven strategist and management consultant with an exceptional ability to influence and engage others. You thrive on teamwork in a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment where you can get a holistic view on H&M’s business, people, interdependencies within, and opportunities ahead. You have a keen eye for identifying business opportunities, problems, and risks and use your exceptional analytical skills to understand the realities of our customers, making impactful results. You thrive in the intersection between business and technology, and aspire to inspire, guide and influence organizations on the journey towards a digital north star. You are fast to action and keen on making things happen by bringing people onboard through your inclusive communication and empowering leadership style.
   

  

*To be successful in this role we also see that you have:*
* 5+ years of experience in management consulting and/or portfolio management. Focus on tech strategy, digital transformations or tech operating models is a plus.
* Relevant degree in Engineering, Tech, Business, Economics, or a related field.
* Experience in diverse/international environments; retail/FMCG background is a plus
* Passion for innovative technologies and digital business opportunities
* Demonstrated ability to analyze complex business problems and identify solutions
* Strong project management skills and familiarity with strategic methods and toolkits
* Excellent communication, presentation, and stakeholder management skills
* Fluency in English, both verbal and written


 This is a full-time permanent position based in our
 **office in Liljeholmen, Stockholm**
**Additional Information**
**WHO WE ARE**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* Staff discount card: Usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online.
* Competitive pensions: Collective Agreement and ITP pensions competitive to the Swedish market.
* Generous vacation: 30 days’ vacation, health care allowance, and good work-life balance.
* Additional perks: Discounts from Benify.
* Innovative Environment: Work with cutting-edge technology and innovative solutions.
* Global Impact: Be part of a team that influences users worldwide.
* Professional Growth: Endless opportunities to learn and develop your skills.
* Collaborative Culture: Join a motivated team that values collaboration and excellence.


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here. We are eager to meet you!
   

  

*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*

title: Retail Analytical Consultant
description:
**Job Description**
 Would you like to work within the grocery and convenience retail industry? In this role, you will collaborate closely with some of the largest retailers in Sweden, helping them make better decisions based on insights and NielsenIQ data.
   

  

**KEY RESPOBSIBILITIES:**
* Build strong partnerships with the client and delight them by delivering analytical insights, presentations and thought leadership in line with commitments.
* Contribute to client retention by sharing data-driven insights, and supporting their decision-making processes client needs within data driven decisions to support their business.
* Analyze information and collaborate with team members to create impactful presentations. Present findings and recommendations clearly and concisely to stakeholders.
* Deliver best in class insights and presentations tailored to category managers, C-level executives, consumer insights teams, and other stakeholders.
* Take the lead on client accounts. Set the strategy for the account and ensure successful execution.
* Develop and maintain annual joint business plans in close cooperation with the client, ensuring financial targets and KPI’s (such as client satisfaction) are met.
* Work with NielsenIQ’s tools and systems, including Discover, MS Dynamics, and MS Office.
* Be onsite with clients (frequency will be decided based on clients’ portfolio, approximately 2 days per week)


**WHAT IS THE PERFECT CANDIDATE?**
* An analytical mindset and approach
* Ability to draw conclusions from large datasets and present them in a simplified, visualized format.
* Pays attention to details and uses analytical analysis methods
* A good listener when it comes to the client-facing part, with strong presentation and communication skills
* Highly driven, enjoys a variety of tasks, and adapts well to change


**KEY REQUIREMENTS:**
* Minimum 2-4 years of professional or internship experience in the Retail or FMCG industry
* Strong analytical and problem-solving mindset and/or sales experience in a client-facing role, preferably in market research or with FMCG clients or retailers.
* Confidence with numbers and the ability to translate numbers into insights and recommendations.
* Strong presentation skills.
* Ability to work independently when onsite with clients
* Strong interpersonal and networking skills, with the ability to build trust and long-term client relationships
* An engaged and ambitious mindset, unafraid to challenge the status quo.
* Fluent in Swedish and English.


  

  

**WHAT CAN WE OFFER YOU?**
* Professional Growth - You will have a chance to grow with us, leading important clients in Denmark and facing challenges that will bring you to the next stage in your career. You will get the chance to work on exciting projects with leading industry clients and build a strong network.
* Training & Development - You will learn about all the services that NielsenIQ provides. Employees are encouraged to pursue growth opportunities and are provided with professional training to enable them to stay at the forefront of the latest marketing trends.
* Benefits - In addition to your salary, we offer a comprehensive non-financial benefits package, including collective agreements (occupational pension and parental leave), access to our office facilities in Hellerup with a nice canteen, and the opportunity to work with a dedicated team and in a collaborative and inclusive work environment.
* Great Culture - Our core values are client obsessed, driven to win, accountable for results and committed to integrity. You will experience a dynamic, open, international, and solution-oriented environment where you can simply be yourself.


  

  

**ARE YOU THE ONE WE ARE LOOKING FOR?**
 Apply now by clicking the “Apply” button. We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis, and we will close the ad once we have hired our new colleague. Therefore, we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.
   

  

**Additional Information**
**Our Benefits**
* Flexible working environment
* Volunteer time off
* LinkedIn Learning
* Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


**About NIQ**
 NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.
   

  

 For more information, visit NIQ.com
   

  

 Want to keep up with our latest updates?
   

  

 Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook
   

  

**Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion**
 NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

title: License Owner, Stockholm
description:
**Passionate about football (soccer) AND about business? Stranger Soccer is expanding to key cities around the world. We are looking for a License Owner to open and operate the Stranger Soccer business in Stockholm.**
 This is not your traditional management job - it is truly built for someone that wants to own and operate their own business (that happens to make the world's greatest sport accessible to everyone). This role is ideally suited for an adventurous and football-passionate entrepreneur.
   

  

**Sounds Like You?**
 As a next step, please visit www.strangersoccer.com and particularly the section Bring Stranger Soccer to your City to learn more about this dynamic opportunity.
 **If it appears to be a fit, and you wish to learn more, please fill out the form there to officially express your interest.** 
 Be sure to download and explore the Stranger Soccer mobile app as well.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Bring the Stranger Soccer brand and business to life for the assigned city
* Recruit, train, and lead a small central team (2-3 persons) as well as a few freelance Official Hosts (game hosts) to kick off the operation
* Identify and secure prime slots at football venues to run Stranger Soccer games
* Engage in creative sales and marketing digital and hands-onto ensure that customers are introduced to the platform as a convenient and preferred way to play
* Oversee a schedule of games, ensuring customers are delighted with each game they play, and keep coming back for more
* Take advantage of the strong backing and direction of Singapore headquarters, where an operations and technology team is ready to support you.


**You should have**
* A passion for football, and a strong connection to your local football scene
* A business background, ideally in management and customer service
* An entrepreneurial background or spirit
* A commitment to owning, driving, and scaling the Stranger Soccer brand in the assigned market
* A hunger to succeed: financial compensation for this role will be proportionate to hard work, business acumen, and effectiveness.


**About Stranger Soccer**
 With 3.5 billion football enthusiasts in over 200 countries, football is the most popular sport in the world. But why don't more people play it? Stranger Soccer (www.strangersoccer.com) makes playing football as easy as going for a jog or to the gym. Browse dozens of games on its acclaimed Mobile App. Book a slot. Turn up and play.
   

  

 Incorporated in 2017, Stranger Soccer has quickly transformed the sports & recreation scene in Singapore. In a few short years, it has grown to be the #1-way people play football and futsal in the country, amassing tens of thousands of registered users purchasing thousands of slots every week. Whether you call it Fussball, Fútbol, Calcio, or anything else, the world now awaits.
   

  

**Our Mission**
 To make playing football as easy as going for a jog.
   

  

**Our Vision**
 A world in which playing football is as popular and widespread as watching football.
   

  

**Got what it takes?**
**We look forward to meeting you.**

title: Infrastrukturarkitekt
description:
Vill du vara med och forma framtidens digitala samhälle? Nu har du chansen att kliva ombord på vår resa mot en innovativ och digitaliserad framtid, där vi inte bara stärker it-tjänster och drift för våra egna system utan även för andra statliga myndigheter. Vi bygger en ny dynamisk enhet full av kompetens och engagemang, och vi vill att du ska vara med och göra skillnad. Är du redo att vara en del av något stort? Var med och gör samhället möjligt!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Som infrastukturarkitekt hos oss får du en central roll i att driva den tekniska utvecklingen framåt. Du kommer att arbeta med infrastrukturarkitektur, vara länken mellan teknik och verksamhet samt vägleda utvecklingsteam och beslutsfattare mot framtidens lösningar. Ditt fokus kommer ligga på infrastrukturtjänster, där du blir en viktig del av vårt arkitektteam inom Stödjande Tekniska Tjänster (STT). Du trivs med att växla mellan strategiskt, taktiskt och operativt arbete, och du har förmågan att både se helheten och dyka ner i tekniska detaljer. Din insats kommer direkt bidra till Skatteverkets övergång till en informationsdriven och digitaliserad verksamhet.
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och i tätt samarbete mellan it och verksamheten för att skapa utvecklingsvärdeströmmar. Vår tekniska miljö är bred och i ständig utveckling, med steg mot moderna lösningar som privata molntjänster, mikrotjänstarkitektur och containerteknik. På vår förändringsresa hanterar vi både nya och äldre teknologier, vilket ställer krav på att du behärskar flera arkitekturstilar parallellt.
   

  

 Hos oss får du möjlighet till ständig utveckling och lärande i arbetet. Vi jobbar aktivt med kompetens- och teknikutveckling. Du har pålitliga, ödmjuka och kunniga kollegor som du utbyter erfarenheter med och du kan utveckla både bredd och spets hos oss. Tack vare att vi är en stor it-organisation kan vi erbjuda goda möjligheter till intern rörlighet. Det är viktigt för oss att du har balans mellan jobb och fritid och vi erbjuder bland annat flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet att jobba delvis hemifrån. Du får en friskvårdstimme i veckan och friskvårdsbidrag.
   

  

 Här kan du läsa mer om hur det är att jobba med it hos oss och ta del av vad några av våra medarbetare berättar om sina jobb: Jobba med it hos oss
   

  

 Du tillhör it-avdelningen, med placering i Sundbyberg.
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* ha god samarbetsförmåga, vara hjälpsam och ha ett gott bemötande
* ha förmågan och viljan att lära dig nya saker, vara flexibel och öppen för förändringar
* ha god problemlösningsförmåga, se mönster och kunna göra avgränsningar
* vara målfokuserad och bidra till att syftet med verksamheten uppnås
* agera medvetet och professionellt utifrån en god självinsikt
* uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska.


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* högskoleutbildning inom it som arbetsgivaren bedömer relevant för rollen
* flerårig aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet inom infrastrukturarkitektur
* aktuell erfarenhet av privata mjukvarudefinierade datacenter (SDDC)
* grundläggande kunskap i modern säkerhetsarkitektur
* vana att leda och stötta andra arkitekter och team i arkitekturella förändringar.


 Det är önskvärt att du har dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete inom komplexa it-organisationer, t ex myndighet eller annan stor organisation. Det är också önskvärt med flerårig aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet i agil utveckling och användning av modeller för att analysera och dokumentera arkitektur.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/438 | Kontakt: Jerker Moberg, Sektionschef jerker.moberg@skatteverket.se, Therese Schönbeck, HR-specialist therese.schonbeck@skatteverket.se, Yrsa Andersson, HR-specialist yrsa.andersson@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2025-05-19 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-06-09

title: Praktikant till Enheten för IT, hösten 2025
description:
*Folkhälsomyndigheten är en nationell kunskapsmyndighet som arbetar för bättre folkhälsa. Det gör myndigheten genom att utveckla och stödja samhällets arbete med att främja hälsa, förebygga ohälsa och skydda mot hälsohot. Vår vision är en folkhälsa som stärker samhällets utveckling.*
 Är du intresserad av att göra praktik hos oss på Folkhälsomyndigheten? Vi erbjuder praktikplatser varje termin för studenter som läser på högskola, universitet eller yrkeshögskola.
   

  

 Som praktikant kommer du att bli en del av vår verksamhet och få möjlighet att arbeta med egna uppgifter och projekt under handledning. Vårt mål är att praktiken ska vara värdefull för dig som student, samtidigt som vi ser det som ett ömsesidigt utbyte där vi får ta del av nya kunskaper och perspektiv från din utbildning.
   

  

 Om praktiken
   

  

 Enheten för IT har möjlighet att erbjuda praktik med start under höstterminen 2025, och med placeringsort i Solna.
   

  

 Enheten ansvarar för att myndigheten har en säker och tillgänglig it-driftmiljö samt för en effektiv support, förvaltning och modern utveckling av it-system.
   

  

 Enheten ansvarar även för en samordnad och kostnadseffektiv process för inköp av it-relaterad utrustning, licenser och konsulttjänster.
   

  

 Enheten ansvarar för digitalisering inom it-området, vilket inkluderar utvecklings- och förvaltningsstyrning, it-projektkontor, informationssäkerhet samt telefoni och konferenssystem.
   

  

 Uppgifter under praktiken
   

  

 Under din praktikperiod kommer du främst att arbeta med:
   

  

* Koppling från en Java-applikationen till Navet via Navet API (Navet API tillhandahåller funktionalitet för att hämta uppgifter via ett säkert och autentiserat gränssnitt. API:t är byggt med .NET 8 och använder OAuth för autentisering och auktorisering. Det hostas på en IIS-server).
* Java.
* Gitlab.
* Tomcat.
* MariaDB.


 Bakgrund och kompetens
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Pågående studier/utbildning inom systemutveckling.
* Kunskap om säkerhet när det gäller webbapplikationer.
* Kunskap om Webbserver.
* Kunskap inom relationsdatabaser.
* Personliga egenskaper som en god samarbetsförmåga, ansvarstagande och nyfikenhet.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, i både tal och skrift.


 Bra att veta
   

  

 Praktiken ska ha anknytning till en utbildning, vilket innebär att den ska ingå i en utbildning vid ett svenskt lärosäte. Praktikperioden omfattar vanligtvis mellan 10 och 20 veckor, samt påbörjas under höstterminen 2025. Det kan även finnas möjlighet att kombinera praktiken med uppsatsskrivande. Detta ska dock avstämmas med den enhet där du kommer att praktisera. Normalt genomförs praktiken på heltid under kontorsarbetstid. Ingen ekonomisk ersättning utgår för praktiken. Som praktikant ska du vara försäkrad genom ditt lärosäte. Se till att stämma av detta innan du ansöker om praktik.
   

  

 Tillsättningen av praktikplatsen görs efter intervju. Vi hoppas kunna ge dig besked senast i slutet av juni.
   

  

 Så ansöker du
   

  

 Ansök senast 2025-05-25 via myndighetens webbplats genom att ladda upp ditt CV, personliga brev och besvara urvalsfrågor.
   

  

 Har du ytterligare frågor om praktiken är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande handledaren Slavica Cvijan, telefon 010-205 23 07.
   

  

 Läs i ansökningsformuläret hur du går tillväga om du har skyddade personuppgifter.
   

  

 Arbetsgivarens diarienummer: 02395-2025-2.1.1

title: ICT Operation Manager
description:
**Join our Team**
 At Ericsson, the tech firm that created the mobile world, we’re driven by innovation. With over 54,000 patents, we’re committed to shaping the future of technology. Joining our team means you're empowered to learn, lead, and perform at your best. Here, your unique perspective, talent, and skills are celebrated. Are you in?
   

  

 Come, and be where it begins.
   

  

**About this opportunity:**
 BNEW SAN Lab Operations delivers world-class lab infrastructure, networks, and hardware services to R&D organizations. Our standardized solutions support over 23,000 engineers across ~50,000 sqm of labs in Sweden (Stockholm, Linköping, Lindholmen, Lund) and globally (Aachen, Athlone, Budapest, Beijing, Nanjing, Genoa, Jorvas, Ottawa, Pagani, Piscataway).
   

  

**What you will do:**
 We are looking for an ICT Operation Manager to oversee daily operations of lab and data center test environments. You will be the key interface for Lab Operations users and stakeholders. Success in this role requires strong knowledge of hardware installation, RF, and UE, combined with excellent relationship-building skills.
   

  

 This position is based in Stockholm, reporting to the Manager SAN LSO STO HW Inst & Ops 1.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Serve as the local site contact for Lab Operations users/stakeholders
* Ensure quality deliveries based on user priorities
* Coordinate user needs with SAN LSO STO facility infrastructure teams
* Drive user satisfaction and handle delivery flow issues
* Identify risks and communicate impediments
* Recommend process and service improvements
* Reject non-lab operations-related requests
* Challenge unnecessary investment costs
* Support BRM and Line Managers with site-level forecasts
* Join operative meetings with users and internal Lab Operations
* Conduct and share Root Cause Analyses (RCA)
* Lead and monitor delivery-related task forces


**Typical Interfaces (not limited to):**
* Line Manager
* SAN LSO internal teams
* Internal users/stakeholders
* External stakeholders


**Behavioral Competencies:**
* Adaptability & resilience under pressure
* Commitment to Ericsson values and principles
* Analytical mindset
* Gatekeeping approved routines
* Consultative and structured approach
* Strategic thinking and decision-making
* Leadership and people management
* Persuasion and influence
* Planning and organization
* Customer-focused delivery


**The skills you bring:**
* High expertise in HW installation, RF, and UE
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Strong collaboration and problem-solving abilities
* Solid experience in people leadership
* Background in global delivery with multiple stakeholders
* Willingness to learn and grow, both practically and theoretically
* Familiarity with lean and agile practices in large organizations
* Structured working style and commitment to quality
* Commercial thinking and entrepreneurial mindset
* Effective presentation and interpersonal skills
* A team-oriented attitude aligned with the “One Ericsson” spirit


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 766591

title: Delivery Lead / Project Manager – Digital HR solutions
description:
**Company Description**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Are you passionate about leading digital transformation with real business impact? Do you thrive in global complexity, and love turning ideas into structured action? In the role as
 **Delivery Lead** 
 , you won’t just manage timelines and deliverables, you’ll drive some of our most strategic HR tech initiatives, including the rollout of our global salary review tool and futureproofing how we handle compensation data. You’ll lead initiatives across time zones, tech teams and HR functions as well as operate in one of the world’s most expansive HR tech environments.
   

  

 This is your chance to make a mark in a high-impact role, where hybrid project methodologies meet real global scale and your leadership truly matters.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Lead and deliver large scale digital HR projects with global reach, from concept to implementation.
* Act as a connector between HR and Tech, translating needs into system solutions.
* Apply both agile and traditional project management methods.
* Coordinate cross-functional project teams.
* Drive clarity around scope, goals, timelines and governance.
* Collaborate closely with global stakeholders and steer progress in an evolving landscape.
* Contribute to smarter, more sustainable ways of working across delivery and change.


**Qualifications**
 We believe you are a structured doer with a strategic mind – someone who thrives in navigating both complexity and ambiguity, and who brings people together to get things done. To succeed in this role, you likely bring:
   

  

* Proven experience leading large scale digital projects, ideally within HR or enterprise tech environments.
* Hands-on knowledge of both agile and traditional project management methodologies.
* The ability to lead cross-functional teams without formal leadership.
* Experience working in global, matrix organizations, and navigating the challenges that come with it.
* A background in or passion for HR processes and systems (SAP SuccessFactors or similar is a plus).
* Strong communication and stakeholder management skills across seniority levels and cultures.
* A pragmatic mindset, with an eye for both long-term and short-term realities.
* Fluent in English.


**Additional Information**
 This is a full-time position based in Stockholm. Apply by sending in your CV in English as soon as possible, but no later than 30-May 2025. We will review and interview candidates ongoing. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through the career page.

title: Office Operation Manager  - Sweden (1-Year Temp)
description:
**Intelligently Moving Your World** 




  





**XPENG** 
 is a leading technology company focused on designing, developing, manufacturing, and marketing intelligent mobility solutions, including electric vehicles (EVs), electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) aircraft, and robotics. We aim to create a thoughtful and empathetic future for mobility that enhances driving experience. Headquartered in Guangzhou, China, XPENG has regional offices in Beijing, Shanghai, Shenzhen, Silicon Valley, and San Diego, and in 2021, we established our European headquarters in Amsterdam, along with offices in Copenhagen, Munich, Oslo, and Stockholm.
 



  





 Our passionate and diverse team, with expertise in technology, finance, and the automotive industry, spans hubs in China, the US, and Europe. Together, we are forging our international presence as pioneers in the future of mobility.
 



  





**Why should you be part of our success story?** 




**XPENG** 
 Inc.'s American Depositary Shares (ADSs) have been listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) under the symbol 'XPEV' since August 27, 2020, and on the Stock Exchange of Hong Kong Limited (SEHK) under the symbol '9868.HK' since July 7, 2021. In 2023, XPENG further strengthened its growth trajectory with a $724 million strategic investment from Volkswagen, solidifying its position in the global market. There has never been a more exciting time to join XPENG — a leader in smart electric vehicles and sustainable mobility solutions.
 



  





**Job Summary:** 




 We are seeking a highly organized and proactive
 **Office Operations Manager** 
 to oversee daily administrative operations and ensure the efficient functioning of our office environment. This role requires excellent leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills, with the ability to manage multiple responsibilities in a fast-paced setting.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Oversee and coordinate all office operations to ensure a smooth and efficient working environment.
* Manage office supplies, equipment, and inventory; coordinate maintenance as needed.
* Provide regular training for employees based on business needs to help them become more proficient in using internal systems.
* Implement and maintain office policies and procedures to enhance operational effectiveness.
* Liaise with vendors, service providers, and building management to ensure high-quality service.
* Coordinate office moves, seating arrangements, and space planning.
* Manage budgets related to office operations, including vendor contracts and supply expenses.
* Oversee health, safety, and security compliance within the office environment.
* Assist the HR department with resume screening and other related tasks, as well as onboarding and offboarding processes.
* Support senior leadership with scheduling, meeting planning, and administrative tasks as required.
* Plan and execute company events, meetings, and team-building activities.



  





**Requirements:** 



* 5+ years of experience in office management, operations, or a related administrative role.
* Prior experience in a multinational or corporate environment.
* Strong organizational and project management skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and office management tools.
* Ability to multitask and adapt in a dynamic, fast-paced work environment.
* Experience in human resources, with preferred knowledge of budgeting and basic financial principles.
* Fluent in English, Swedish and Chinese.



  





**XPENG offers:** 



* An interesting, unique and very varied job at XPENG
* A job with an incredibly large contact surface both internally and externally
* An attractive salary package incl. pension and with the possibility of a bonus
* To be involved in the growth of an existing EV brand in Europe



  





**Next steps:** 




 To comply with GDPR, we can’t process your personal data without your given consent. Therefore, please apply directly via
 **LinkedIn** 
 portal so that our team can proceed further.
 



  





 As part of our application process, certain positions at our company require a
 **pre-employment screening** 
 to ensure the reliability and integrity of our employees. This screening is a standard procedure and may include components such as a Criminal Background Check from your current or previous country of residence over the past five years. Additionally, the process may involve an integrity questionnaire, verification of identification, diplomas, work experience, and consultation of the central insolvency register.
 



  





 We appreciate your understanding and cooperation in this important matter, as it helps us maintain the high standards expected by our team.
 



  





**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion:** 




 At XPENG, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that values diversity and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of race, religion, sex, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability status or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: IT Internal Control System Manager
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 We are looking for an Internal Control System (ICS) Manager, who would like to contribute to an effective internal control environment within Scania Commercial Operations.
   

  

 In this position, you will join the Global ICS team and work in an international environment, closely collaborating and coordinating activities with Head of IT Commercial Operations and IT Managers in the Regional Organisation. You will get an opportunity to overview and understand the business model of Scania in general and Commercial Operations including IT specifically, and possibilities to create a network in Scania’s organization.
   

  

 Internal Control Function at Scania is a second line function within Corporate Control, with objective to support Scania Group to accomplish its objectives by bringing a systematic approach to evaluate, monitor, report on and improve the effectiveness of internal controls, both in business process and for IT applications. Your line Manager will be Head of Internal Control, and you will have close cooperation with the Head of IT for Commercial Operations, Regional IT Directors as well as global network of IT Managers in Business Units.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Ensure compliance to regulations on ICS including continuous development of internal controls for IT applications for financial and non-financial reporting in alignment with Scania’s and TRATON group framework for Internal Controls
* Support Senior Management on ICS matters and IT Managers in design of new and improved controls
* Conduct trainings to increase the awareness about risks and internal controls
* Prepare annual control evaluation plan, perform sample testing and support Management Self-Assessment
* Regularly document ICS matters in TRATON Internal Control Application (TICA), e.g. control maturity level and results from sample testing
* Regularly report on ICS matters to main stakeholders and prepare input to the Scania Group ICS report to Audit Committee
* Follow-up on control deficiencies and remediating actions, share best practice examples
* Continuously develop internal procedures related to development and evaluation of internal controls ensuring efficiency and effectiveness of the system
* Closely cooperate with external audit and IT ICS Managers in other parts of Scania as well as within other Brands in TRATON Group


**Who You Are**
 You have a relevant academic degree, at least 5 years’ experience of working with IT operations, IT General Controls, IT Audits or IT Risk and Compliance Management. You have experience of project management, thrive in teamwork and have excellent communication skills. It is crucial that you have a big passion for continuous improvement, always looking for efficient and effective solutions for the best benefit of the business operations.
   

  

 You are able to analyse risks and understand control deficiencies, identify solutions and support sound decision making. We are looking for you who have high integrity and an open-minded approach towards your tasks. You are very structured, detailed oriented and well organized, always with a great customer focus. You want to add perspective and value to the team and all stakeholders.
   

  

 You are fluent in English, both verbally and in writing. Other world languages are a merit.
   

  

*We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experience and perspectives is valuable to us.*
**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application shall include a personal letter and CV as well as copies of any relevant certificates. Evaluation of applicants will be done continuously and we, therefore, look forward to your application as soon as possible, by
 **june 1st 2025** 
 at the latest. We also need your full name, address, e-mail, and cell phone number to register your application. We will not consider incomplete mail applications.
   

  

**Further information**
 This is permanent employment, and the position is located in Södertälje. If you have any further questions regarding the position, please contact Agnieszka Arshamian (Head of Internal Control at Scania), +46 8 553 863 90.
 **We look forward to your application!**

title: Sales Executive - New Business - PSO
description:
Meet Unit4, a fast-paced, game-changing SaaS company revolutionizing ERP for scale-ups, mid-market organizations, and category leaders. We’re not just rewriting the rules of enterprise software; we’re tearing up the old playbook. For 40 years, the ERP industry has been bogged down by clunky, legacy systems, and we’re here to shake things up.
   

  

  

  

 At Unit4, we’re all about transformation. We empower ambitious businesses with cutting-edge ERP solutions that are adaptive, intuitive, and self-driving—designed to free organizations from the mundane and help them focus on what truly matters. Our mission? To turn work into something more meaningful while helping our customers achieve their greatest potential. Want to learn more about how we’re reshaping the future? Head to our website and see how we’re helping businesses thrive.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 We’ve got an exciting opportunity, to join our high-energy, fast-growing sales team. If you’re a natural hunter, a born deal-closer, and someone who thrives in fast-paced environments, this is your chance to shine.
   

  

  

  

 As a New Business Sales Executive, you’ll play a critical role in driving digital transformation for scale-ups, mid-market organizations, and category leaders in the Professional Services sector. Your mission: sell Unit4’s ERP Financial and HCM solutions, win new logos, and help our clients unlock their true potential.
   

  





  

  

*This is a hybrid role based out of our Stockholm office.*




 What You’ll Do
   

  




* Craft and execute a killer new business sales strategy to hit ambitious targets in the Professional Services vertical.
* Qualify leads like a pro and engage key decision-makers with a consultative, value-driven approach.
* Own complex sales cycles from start to finish, orchestrating cross-functional teams—pre-sales, value engineering, marketing, and more—to close big deals.
* Deliver powerful, results-oriented presentations to C-level execs, focusing on their core challenges and the Office of the CFO.
* Help prospects see the business impact of our solutions, turning skeptics into believers.
* Stay ahead of the curve by mastering our tech and keeping up with industry trends


**Qualifications**
* You’re a go-getter with at least 3-5 years of experience selling complex SaaS solutions.
* You have a proven track record in ERP
 
 or SaaS sales (mandatory).
* You’re a pro at navigating the Professional Services sector and understand its unique needs.
* Business processes? You know them inside and out.
* You have the charisma to inspire, the resilience to negotiate, and the vision to guide clients toward success.
* You’re a team player with a hunter’s mindset, always looking for that next big win.
* You’re comfortable engaging and influencing C-level executives, turning tough challenges into bold opportunities.
* Mentorship, leadership, and collaboration come naturally to you—you’re always ready to lift others while driving results.


**Additional Information**

 Why Unit4?
   

  





  

  

 At Unit4, we believe in big ideas, bold action, and breaking barriers. Here’s what sets us apart:
   

  




* Freedom to Thrive: We trust you to own your role and drive success, offering autonomy and flexibility.
* Uncapped Time Off: Take the time you need to recharge—your well-being matters.
* Global Wellbeing Days: When we say “switch off,” we mean it. We all take time to prioritize health and balance.
* Next-Level Talent: Collaborate with some of the sharpest minds in the software industry.
* Purpose-Driven Impact: Be part of our Act4Good program, where innovation meets sustainability to make the world better.
* Inclusive Culture: We’re committed to diversity, equity, and belonging through our Employee Resource Groups like Women at Unit4, Pride at Unit4, and Mental Health & Access at Unit4.



 This is your chance to join a company that’s as ambitious as you are. If you’re ready to disrupt the status quo and make a real impact, let’s talk.
   

  

  

  

 Ready to take the leap? Apply now and let’s make work better, together.

title: IT-ansvarig
description:
**Till ett av Sveriges mest kundvänliga fastighetsbolag söker vi nu en IT-ansvarig**
 Är du en engagerad, ansvarsfull, självständig och social person som värderar samarbete och vi-känsla högt? Känner du både yrkesstolthet och arbetsglädje? Härligt, då hoppas vi att du vill komma till oss och bidra till vår vision om att ”skapa rum där människor trivs, utvecklas och mår bra”! På Tornberget är vi lite extra stolta över vår kompetens och serviceanda som vid alla kundundersökningar hittills nått den absoluta toppen i Sverige.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Du kommer att tillhöra vår avdelning Verksamhetsstöd tillsammans med ett 10-tal kollegor. Avdelningen leds av vår ekonomichef som även är vice VD.
   

  

 Rollen som IT-ansvarig har i uppdrag att samordna och säkerställa Tornbergets it-behov på en taktisk och till viss del operativ nivå i nära samverkan med Haninge kommuns centrala IT. Första linjens IT-support sköts av Haninge kommuns centrala IT och strategiskt stöd tillhandahålls från Haninge kommuns centrala IT, via IT-chefen.
   

  

**Jobbet innebär bland annat att du ansvarar för att**
* Samordna och stödja verksamhetens strategiska arbete kopplat till IT-området
* Vara den primära kontaktytan mellan Tornberget och Haninge kommuns centrala IT.
* Delta i taktiska samverkansmöten med Haninge kommuns IT
* Behovsinventera löpande internt på Tornberget och sammanställa dessa behov
* Kunna göra förstudier och även leda projekt vid t.ex. nya inköp/införanden av system eller digitala arbetssätt
* Ta fram Tornbergets övergripande IT-budget, prognostisera och följa upp.
* Driva tekniska beslut framåt och aktivt hjälpa till med viss teknik vid behov.
* Samverka med Tornbergets systemspecialister och vid behov stötta i leverantörsstyrning/ uppföljning och uppgraderingar samt tester
* Vara ett stöd i taktiska tekniska frågor till Tornbergets ledningsgrupp
* Informera och sprida kunskap om Haninge IT:s rutiner och processer och säkerställa att de efterlevs
* Bidra i felsökning och medverka i ändringar av IT-miljön


**Om dig**
 Tjänsten passar dig som har en god samarbets- och initiativförmåga och en hög grad av servicekänsla. Du är bra på att skapa goda relationer och på att planera och genomföra arbete tillsammans i samverkan med kollegor, leverantörer och andra. För oss är det viktigt att dina personliga egenskaper och värderingar stämmer överens med vår värdegrund och att du är lösningsorienterad och flexibel. Du vill skapa delaktighet, trygghet och bidra till våra gemensamma värden.
   

  

**Dina kvalifikationer**
* Relevant högskoleutbildning alt annan relevant eftergymnasial utbildning
* Intresse och god förståelse för IT-miljöer
* Kunna verka i en komplex IT-miljö och ha god grundläggande allmän teknisk kompetens
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att leda förändringsarbete inom IT-området
* Mycket god samarbetsförmåga både internt och externt
* Självgående och proaktiv
* Erfarenhet av att göra förstudier och projektleda inom IT-området
* Besitter förmågan att förklara teknik på ett lätt sätt för användare vid förändringar och nya införanden
* Grundläggande kunskaper inom IT-säkerhet
* God kommunikativ förmåga både skriftligt och muntligt på svenska
* Lösningsfokuserad och serviceinriktad


 Erfarenhet av IT i fastighetsbolag är meriterande.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Tornberget är ett kommunalt fastighetsförvaltningsbolag i Haninge. Vi äger och förvaltar kommunala verksamhetsfastigheter såsom skolor, förskolor, fritidsgårdar, bibliotek samt äldre- och omsorgslokaler. Totalt äger vi ca 300 000 m2
   

  

 Antalet medarbetare är drygt 100. Våra moderna kontorslokaler ligger centralt i Haninge, nära buss- och pendeltågsstationer. Runt hörnet finns butiker, restauranger och Rudans friluftsområde.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder dig ett meningsfullt arbete på en välkomnande och öppen arbetsplats där samarbete och utveckling står i fokus – både på individ- och bolagsnivå. Du ges tillgång till företagshälsovård och generösa friskvårdsförmåner. Vi erbjuder också möjlighet till flexibel arbetstid och distansarbete. Vår arbetstid är rökfri. Vi har certifierats som ett Great Place to Work vid varje mätning som vi gjort i den världsomspännande arbetsplatsundersökningen Great Place to Work.
   

  

**Sök tjänsten**
 Välkommen med din ansökan innehållande CV och löneanspråk senast den 2025-06-09.
   

  

*Vi kallar till intervjuer löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.*
 Tester inom rekryteringsprocessen kan förekomma. Bakgrundskontroll kommer att genomföras på slutkandidat. Vi undanber oss samtliga annonsförsäljare.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidare med provanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Haninge | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/7 | Kontakt: Daniel Arefalk 086068737, | Facklig företrädare: Johan Broo 086065409, | Publicerat: 2025-05-19 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-06-09

title: Associate Information Security Officer – based in Luxembourg
description:
**This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.** 
 The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.
   

  

 The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Group Risk & Compliance Directorate (GR&C), Office of the Group Chief Compliance Officer (GR&C-OCCO), Group Non-Financial Risk Department (GNFR), Project Management and Information Security Division (PMI), Information Security Risk Unit (InfoSec) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an
 **Associate Information Security Officer\*.**
**This is a full-time position at grade 4 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.**
* internal benchmark Associate Officer


*Panel interviews are foreseen as from June 2025.*
 Purpose
   

  

 We are seeking a skilled
 **Associate** 
**Information Security Officer** 
 to join our team, focusing on the
 **2nd Line of Defence** 
 . In this role, you will be instrumental in safeguarding the bank’s assets by combining technical expertise with governance, risk management, and policy enforcement.
   

  

 This position offers a unique opportunity to work in a
 **complex and dynamic environment** 
 , where every day brings new challenges – from risk assessments and policy reviews to testing the resilience of our IT defences. You will coordinate and oversee Information Security risk management activities, driving a proactive approach to identifying, preventing, and mitigating security threats that could impact the organization.
   

  

 Join us if you want to work at the intersection of
 **cybersecurity, risk, and governance** 
 , while being part of a collaborative and driven team at the #EU\_ClimateBank.
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 The 2nd Line of Defence has been centralized within the GR&C Directorate in an Information Security Risk Unit.
   

  

 You will work in close collaboration with other colleagues in the Bank for the integration of information security into policies, procedures and processes. You will report to the Head of Information Security Risk Unit. Internally, you will work in collaboration with the Office of the Group Chief Compliance Officer (GR&C-OCCO), Inspector General’s Office (IG) and other relevant services as required for the investigation and escalation of events arising from non-compliance with the information security policies. You will also work with Group Corporate Services (GCS) and all Directorates of the Bank for the implementation of agreed information security measures. Externally, you will interact with security related professions.
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

 Coordinate the implementation of an Information Security Management System (ISMS) consistent with the imposed requirements and/or regulations. This will include:
   

  

* Developing and maintaining the Bank’s information security-related policies, standards and procedures, in close cooperation with IT Security, IPAQ (Information Protection, Access Control and Quality), Physical Security, Data Protection Office and other EIB Group services whenever require.
* Overseeing and coordinating the implementation, the review and the update of inter-alia the Bank’s Information Security Policies framework.
* Proactively formulating proposals for the integration of information security into the Bank’s policies.


 Ensure the undertaking, the lead implementation and the monitoring of the risk assessment process of the Bank.
   

  

 Coordinate the development of relevant key risk indicators and associated reporting dashboards and the implementation of consequent information security controls in collaboration with other relevant services of the Bank.
   

  

 Coordinate, Supervise And/or Execute Key Processes Related To Information Security Policies, In Order To Ensure Successful Implementation, Maintenance And Continuous Improvement Of An Information Security Management System. This May Include
   

  

* Supporting Business Owners in carrying out information security risk assessments.
* Monitoring the implementation of agreed information security controls in the Bank.
* Managing external staff resources for the successful delivery of information security risk assessments and projects on time and according to business requirements.
* Identifying and performing due diligence in line with EIB Group processes for the implementation of adequate tooling.
* Being a key interlocutor with Internal and external auditors.
* Being involved in Information Security Incident Management response.
* Coordinating Information Security Awareness Program actions amongst Bank personnel (both permanent staff and consultants/contractors) through training and communication programmes.
* Assessing relevant best banking practices on information security, defining compliance roadmaps as well as reporting dashboards on compliance.
* Acting as 2nd Line of Defence for the information security processes in the 1st Line of Defence area by overseeing the risks and advising on measures to be taken to ensure compliance.


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) ideally complemented with relevant post-graduate studies in field of risk management, IT or information management
* Minimum 3 years relevant experience in the area of information security, preferably in financial sector
* Experience in supporting information security implementation, information security audit, preferably in a financial services domain
* Ability to balance governance with a technical mindset, blending both to effectively challenge and support 1st line functions
* The relevant certifications e.g. CISA, CISSP, CISM, GCIH would be an advantage
* Experience with Cloud Service Providers would be an advantage
* Proven understanding of the financial services sector and interdependencies linked to cybersecurity
* Knowledge sharing skills, including presentation, drafting of documentation
* Knowledge of ethical hacking techniques and understanding of how to test and validate defences (hands-on experience or oversight) would be an asset,
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*\*), with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

*(\*\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of* 
*level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

*This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.*

title: Gruppchef till IT-avdelningen
description:
Pensionsmyndigheten är en myndighet som ligger i framkant när det handlar om teknik och utveckling. IT-avdelningen består idag av ca 350 medarbetare och växer kraftigt för att möjliggöra genomförandet av pensionsgruppens överenskommelse om långsiktigt höjda och trygga pensioner. För oss inom IT innebär detta nyutveckling, under många år framöver, av ett flertal nya pensionsförmånssystem med den senaste tekniken och arbetssätt. Som en del av vår IT-avdelning kommer du att verka i en miljö präglad av stort driv och hög ambitionsnivå samtidigt som vi värnar om en sund balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Vår vision är att leverera bäst IT för Sverige.
   

  

 Vill du leda ett team som bidrar till samhällsnytta?
   

  

 Pensionsmyndigheten söker nu en engagerad och trygg gruppchef till en av fyra grupper inom Utvecklingsenheten Leva på vår IT-avdelning. Här får du en nyckelroll i en organisation som präglas av teknik i framkant och ett meningsfullt uppdrag.
   

  

 På IT-avdelningen är vi ca 350 medarbetare och vårt samhällsviktiga uppdrag gör att vi behöver bli fler. Som en del av vår IT-avdelning kommer du att jobba i en utvecklande miljö, med fokus på medarbetares engagemang och nya idéer. Vi lägger samtidigt mycket energi på att skapa en inkluderande kultur med fokus på jämställdhet och hållbara medarbetare. Vi tror att olika perspektiv och erfarenheter gör oss bättre!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Gruppen rymmer systemutvecklare, testare, kravanalytiker, scrum masters och systemarkitekter. De är fördelade i tvärfunktionella team som jobbar i myndighetens agila utvecklingståg.
   

  

 I uppdraget som gruppchef stöttar du både de agila teamen i den dagliga leveransen, samt organisationen runt omkring. Det handlar om att skapa bra förutsättningar för en arbetsmiljö som är inkluderande och kreativ och som underlättar delaktighet, ansvarstagande och engagemang. Som gruppchef kommer du att klargöra förväntningar, följa upp och ge feedback till var och en genom samtal och individuella målkontrakt. Här kommer din förmåga att motivera och uppmuntra dina medarbetare samt att utveckla den egna kompetensen in i bilden.
   

  

 Du ingår också i ledningsgruppen för Utvecklingsenheten Leva. Tillsammans med enhetschefen och tre gruppchefskollegor leder du där såväl det operativa som det övergripande strategiska arbetet genom att driva frågor inom både IT-avdelningens och myndighetens utvecklingsarenor.
   

  

 Gruppen liksom enhetens ledningsgrupp är sprid över våra kontor i Luleå och Stockholm.
   

  

 Du har budget -och personalansvar samt ansvarar för gruppens resultat.
   

  

 Pensionsmyndigheten ligger i framkant med att prova tekniska innovationer och vår IT-avdelning har en framskjuten plats inom myndigheten. Du kan se fram emot att arbeta i en dynamisk och omväxlande miljö, med kunniga och engagerade medarbetare.
   

  

 Några återkommande arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Ansvara för årligt budgetarbete, samt månatlig uppföljning och kvartalsvis prognostisering
* Genomföra årliga medarbetarsamtal med måluppsättning, samt uppföljning av målen
* Genomföra årliga lönesamtal
* Aktivt leda, inspirera och delta i arbetet kring gruppens uppdrag


**Din profil**
 Vi värnar om att ha en generös och öppen kultur. För att nå våra mål har vi stort fokus på vår kultur och hur vi tillsammans påverkar vår arbetsplats. Du bör därför ha ett intresse och en vilja att vara en del av denna kulturresa. Vi arbetar aktivt med vårt medarbetarskap som omfattar alla på myndigheten och består av tre nyckelområden. Vi tar ansvar, möjliggör förändring och driver utveckling.
   

  

 Du är lyhörd och har passion för det du gör och är bra på att inspirera även på distans.
   

  

 Du tycker om förändringsarbete och är van att leda och coacha människor igenom detta. För dig är den snabba återkopplingen och att agera på den lika viktig för våra tekniska system som i samarbetet mellan människor.
   

  

 Dina personliga egenskaper med betoning på ledaregenskaper är viktiga för rollen som gruppchef och något vi kommer lägga stor vikt vid.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Akademisk examen eller annan utbildning som vi bedömer som relevant
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet som chef med budget- och personalansvar
* Erfarenhet av, och förmåga att leda en grupp som har stor teknisk kompetens
* Goda kunskaper i svenska, i tal och skrift


 Det är meriterande om du har
   

  

* Erfarenhet av agil IT-utveckling och systemförvaltning
* Erfarenhet av förändringsledning
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en hybrid miljö


**Vi erbjuder**
 Ett myndighetsuppdrag som är viktigt på riktigt! En arbetsplats där vi värnar om att våra medarbetare ska ha en god balans mellan arbete och fritid. Vi erbjuder flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet att jobba delvis hemifrån. Som statligt anställd har du även goda anställningsvillkor och ett förmånspaket med friskvård, lediga klämdagar samt goda semester- och pensionsvillkor.
   

  

 Vårt kontor i Stockholm ligger i nära anslutning till Hornstulls tunnelbanestation där vi sitter i ljusa moderna lokaler. I Luleå ligger vårt nybyggda kontor på Porsön i Luleå Science Park.
   

  

 Du kan läsa mer om våra förmåner och hur det är att jobba hos oss här.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid och vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning.
   

  

 Den här tjänsten är placerad på vårt kontor vid Hornstull, Stockholm.
   

  

 Resor i tjänsten förekommer och ingår som ett återkommande inslag.
   

  

 Anställningen kan komma att placeras i säkerhetsklass.
   

  

**Din ansökan**
 Vi jobbar kompetensbaserat i hela processen och är måna om en inkluderande, rättvis, objektiv och kandidatvänlig process. Därför ber vi dig att besvara ett antal urvalsfrågor istället för att be om personligt brev.
   

  

 Vi kommer att använda oss av arbetspsykologiska tester.
   

  

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter kontakta rekryterande chef som hjälper dig med din ansökan.
   

  

 Vi strävar efter en jämn könsfördelning och ser mångfald som en styrka och välkomnar därför sökande med olika bakgrund.
   

  

 Inför rekryteringsarbetet har vi tagit ställning till annonskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanber oss därför ytterligare kontakt med media-/annonsförsäljare, rekryteringssajter och liknande.
   

  

*Pensionsmyndigheten ansvarar för den allmänna pensionen och informerar om hela pensionen. Varje år betalar vi ut cirka 415 miljarder kronor till 2,3 miljoner pensionärer, genomför cirka 911 000 fondbyten och skickar ut 8 miljoner orange kuvert. Vi har ca 25 miljoner digitala kundkontakter per år. Vi är cirka 1700 medarbetare på åtta orter, från Luleå i norr till Halmstad i söder.*
*Vi gör pensionen enklare.*
*#VårtJobbBerörAlla*
 Anställningsform: tillsvidare med provanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: PSL 2025-74 | Kontakt: Annika Francke Sandberg , | Facklig företrädare: Linda Modin, Saco-s 010-4543336, Katarina Safar Leinikka, ST 010-4543587, | Publicerat: 2025-05-19 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-06-09

title: Customer Support Specialist
description:
**The** 
 interest for flight simulation is soaring and so are we! Navigraph is currently looking for a Customer Support Specialist for our office in Gamla Stan, Stockholm (soon Norra Bantorget as we’ve grown out of our current office). At Navigraph we pride ourselves on the close relationship with our users. We interact with flight simulation pilots worldwide to collect feedback for product development, help with getting started, and ensure new pilots feel welcome in our community. This is your chance to be a part of a great team representing a brand users have known and loved for many years. 
 



  





**About Navigraph** 




 Navigraph is a world-leading SaaS company serving serious flight simulator pilots with charts, navigation data, and flight planning services. Our software, built on the latest technology, offers a unique user experience in flight simulation. Navigraph has a strong brand, dedicated users, established products, a great product/market fit, and a clear product roadmap. We are in an excellent position to grow and will provide you with all the means necessary to excel in your work. 
 



 We have a global crew of c. 45 aviation-loving professionals and growing. Our founders Magnus Axholt (CEO) and Stephen O’Connell (CTO) are still active in the company and our team thrives on creativity, experimentation, and collaboration. 
 



 Check out our career site for more information on who we are ✨. 
 



  





**What You’ll Do!** 




 As Customer Support Specialist you will join the Navigraph Support Team in providing first-line support to users via email, social media, and support forum. Typical inquiries relate to subscription and user account management, reimbursements, pre-purchase questions, and product feedback. In a typical month, the team handles 1,300 forum posts, 500 emails, and a varying amount of social media posts; however, we are expecting these numbers to grow. As a part of the team you will also create and maintain answers to frequently asked questions, and policy documents, to continuously evaluate the service level. 
 



  





 The Navigraph Support Team is divided into front-line and back-office support and comprises 13 individuals with varying expertise. The team members are typically also active within other company areas, such as community management, development, and user experience. The work hours are typically Swedish office hours.
 



  





 The team is evaluated on the number of tickets handled, initial response time, total resolution time, and customer satisfaction.
 



  





**What You’ll Need!** 



* Fluency in English
* Strong written communication skills
* Previous work experience within customer support, hospitality, or sales.
* Experience with ZenDesk or similar issue tracking system
* Problem-solving skills and attention to detail
* Empathy, patience and service-mindedness



  





**What we offer!** 




 A vibrant team where we have adopted a creative learning culture. Experimentation and innovation are strongly encouraged.  
 



  




* **Flexible hiring:** 
 On-site or hybrid. The position is based in Stockholm.
* **Work-Life Balance:** 
 Flexible hours and the freedom to work remotely
* **Perks:** 
 A great benefits package; please check out our career site.
* Growth Opportunities: We’ll support your professional development and give you the resources to excel.
* **Tech set-up:** 
 We’ll equip you with everything you need - including access to our very own in-house studio!
* **Memorable experiences:** 
 The Navigraph team is a tight-knit group with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We enjoy spending time together, and it is not uncommon for our yearly trips to flight simulator conventions in Europe and the U.S. to be combined with team-building activities that leave lasting impressions!



  





**How to Join the Team?** 




 We’re reviewing applications quickly - so don’t leave us hanging too long! 🚀✈️ Apply now!

title: Information Architect
description:
Are you ready to shape the future of information management with us at Seco? With a new strategic cycle on the horizon, we’re embarking on a transformative journey and we want you to be a part of it.
   

  

 As our Information Architect, you’ll have the unique opportunity to influence our direction, challenge yourself, and develop your skills in a dynamic environment. You'll build broad networks within Seco and beyond, gaining insights into our entire organization. This role offers a broad scope and a great playground for those who thrive on innovation and enjoy not being boxed in!
   

  

**About The Job**
 Your primary mission is to support the development and implementation of our enterprise information architecture strategy. By seeing information as a strategic asset, you facilitate qualitative, secure, and efficient data flows across our organization. Your role is pivotal in aligning information management with business strategies and supporting digital transformation initiatives.
   

  

 An important part of your mission is driving the evolution of our information architecture from its current state to the target state, ensuring alignment between business, technology, and data strategies.
   

  

 Key responsibilities:
   

  

* Define and maintain our enterprise information architecture strategy and roadmap.
* Collaborate with Sandvik and Sandvik Machining Solutions, Seco Enterprise IT, business functions, solution architects, and system owners to analyze business needs and define information requirements, structures, and flows.
* Create and maintain enterprise-wide data models, taxonomies, metadata structures, and reusable information assets to ensure consistency and scalability.
* Develop enterprise data governance policies, ensuring data quality, security, and regulatory compliance with numerous data protection laws worldwide.
* Facilitate dialogues with subject matter experts, solution architects, system owners, and other key stakeholders to define information requirements.
* Recommend and implement new technologies, services, and processes to improve enterprise data management and information governance.
* Act as a trusted advisor, advocating for information as a strategic asset and representing Seco in Sandvik Group governance forums and initiatives.


 This role offers the opportunity for remote work within Sweden. It’s a plus if you’re able to join your colleagues in either Stokholm or Fagersta on a regular basis.
   

  

**Your profile** 
  

  

 We seek a candidate with a passion for information management and a willingness to learn. You should understand ERP and MES architecture and have some experience in a matrix organization. A relevant IT or business degree is required, and certifications like TOGAF 9 or CISSP are preferred. Ideally, you have some years’ experience in Information Architecture, Data Management, or Enterprise Architecture, including Information Governance frameworks.
   

  

 Key Skills:
   

  

* Data Architecture: Designing scalable data architectures, managing ETL/ELT pipelines.
* Cloud Technologies: Experience with AWS, Azure, GCP.
* Data Management: Master Data Management, metadata management, data security.
* Advanced Technologies: AI and analytics enablement.
* Methodologies: Agile & DevOps practices.


 To thrive in this role, you have a strategic mindset, strong project and change management skills, and the ability to manage multiple initiatives. With excellent communication and presentation skills, you’re able to explain concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Collaboration, influencing, networking, and stakeholder management skills are essential. The ability to multitask and adapt your approach based on sub-cultural awareness is also crucial.
   

  

  

  

**Our Seco culture** 
  

  

 Seco employees across the globe share our family spirit, along with a passion for our customers and a personal commitment to ensure success in everything we do. For us, it’s also clear that our diversities form an amazing foundation for achieving great results. Visit our website, LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us and our products further.
   

  

  

  

**Contact information** 
  

  

 For further information about this position, please contact Kati MacGilleon, recruiting manager, kati.macgilleon@secotools.com
